She has been running her business for the last 5 consecutive years and she has gained a lot of experience in her business. In the future, she has plans to expand her business. Now she is requesting a loan to purchase sport boots in large numbers to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To purchase sport boots in large numbers to increase her business inventory.

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en: Pierre is a 36-year-old Lebanese single man. He’s living with his parents and three working siblings. The whole family cooperates in order to enhance their standard of living. Pierre started to work as a hair dresser on his own in 1997. He has his loyal customers who believe in his fashionable and elegant style. Today, he’s requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a shop for his business and some hair dressing supplies as well. He notes that this will improve his business and allow him to attract more clients. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and better develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase a shop for his business and some hair dressing supplies as well.

loans.name: Blanca Marina

texts.es:
Blanca Marina tiene 38 años de edad es divorciada tiene 5  hijos, vive con la madre y los hijos en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
Blanca Marina se dedica a la cría de animales cómo de pollos, cerdos, además se dedica a la venta de carne asada, tortillas. Solicita el crédito para comprar animales cómo cerdos y comprar carne para el negocio. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los animales y la carne que necesita para el negocio.
La compra lo hará en Chillanes. El sueño es poder construir la vivienda y poder dar el estudio a los hijos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la falta de dinero para solventar las necesidades del hogar.
En el tiempo libre le gusta estar con la familia, ir de paseo, ver televisión y disfrutar de las festividades de santa Rita, La Merced y el Carnaval.
texts.en:
Blanca Marina is 38 years old, divorced, and has five children. She and her children live with her mother in Chillanes, which is in Bolívar Province.

Blanca Marina raises animals, such as pigs and chickens. She also sells roasted meats and tortillas. Blanca is requesting a loan to buy animals, such as pigs, and meat for her business. With this loan, she will be able to buy animals and meat that she needs for her business. Her purchases are conducted in Chillanes. Blanca dreams of building a home and providing an education for her children. The challenges she faces include the lack of money to cover her household necessities.

In her free time, Blanca Marina enjoys spending time with her family by going on walks, watching television, and enjoying the Santa Rita, La Merced, and Carnival festivals.

loans.use: to buy meats for her food business and pigs to raise.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is a 33-year-old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her parents and two siblings, one of whom is working. Her father is their main source of income and trying his best to be as helpful as he can. Rima started her own job from her home. She has been working as a beautician since 2009. She has her loyal customers, and she is happy with the results she has attained so far. Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added beauty products for her business. In that way, she will be able to serve her customers with good quality products. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 48 years old, married, and has three children. She runs a salon to earn a living. She has been operating the business for two years and has employed two people. She also sells clothes to supplement her income. Through Faulu Kenya, she has been trained in business management skills which has helped her improve her business. Beatrice hopes to grow her business in the future.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy a hair dryer.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer.

loans.name: Marìa Aurora

texts.es:
María   es una mujer que tiene 52  años de edad, de estado civil  casada,  vive con su hijo y su cónyuge  en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. María vive en  el caserío Las Adelinas del distrito de Cayaltì del  departamento de  Lambayeque, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica María es la crianza de ganado vacuno y venta de leche  y aves de corral , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad María cuenta con 18 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ella vende su leche en el mercado de Cayalti; Así mismo su cónyuge también se dedica a su chacra donde tiene instalado  1.5  has de cultivo de maíz  lo cual presenta buen estado fenològico y también le apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente María se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de leche, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/.3000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de una mototaxi para poder trasladar su producto (leche) y arreglo de corrales para sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia
texts.en:
María  is a 52 year old married woman who lives with her son and spouse in their own home.  The quality of life in the community is one of subsistence.  The majority of the inhabitants are independent workers who work in the trade and care of small animals and some also work in agriculture.  Maria lives in the farm town Las Adelinas in the Cayaltì district in the department of Piura.  She only has basic electricity.  It is also worth mentioning that in this farm area, approximately 120 families live under these conditions.

Maria works in the commercial activity of raising and vaccinating livestock, selling milk and raising fowl.  These animals are raised outside of her house in external corrals.  Additionally, Maria has 18 years of experience in this line of work, which has allowed her to maintain an established clientele in her business.  She sells her milk at Cayalti market. Her spouse also works his small farm where he has cultivated 1.5 [has] of corn which is phenologically healthy.  Her domestic partner arduously supports her in the activities he does, and there is a good familial relationship between them.  

Currently, Maria has set the goal of expanding her inventory in the raising [of livestock] and the selling of milk.  The reason for this is that it is a very profitable activity in this area.  Thus, she is asking for a new loan for a total of S/.3000 nuevos soles, which will be used to invest in the purchase of a motorcycle-taxi to transport products (milk) and to repair the corrals for her animals.  In time this will allow her to better her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi for her business and to repair her livestock corrals.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca  es una mujer que tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge  y sus tres hijos en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Francisca vive en casa propia en el caserío Ayar Auca  del distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artesanal. Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Francisca es el comercio, crianza, engorde  y venta de  animales menores como: aves de corral y ovinos, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización de estos la realiza ya sea en el mercado local y/o ha compradores mayoristas de animales, cabe destacar que en esta actividad Francisca cuenta con 8 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. 
Actualmente Francisca se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la comercialización, engorde y venta de animales (ovinos y aves de corral), esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 800 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado  a la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde,   y mejoramiento de corrales de sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 38-year-old woman who is in a common-law marriage. She lives with her partner and their three children in their own house. It is said that the quality of life in the community is subsistence level. The majority of the inhabitants are independent workers who work in commerce and raising small animals, and some of them also work in agriculture. Francisca lives in her own house in the village of Ayar Auca in the district of Tambogrande in the department of Piura. In addition, she has only basic electrical service, and water is provided through an artesian well. All the families that live there also live under these conditions.

Francisca's commercial activity is raising, fattening, and selling small animals such as barnyard fowl and sheep. She raises these animals in pens outside her home. Nevertheless, she mentions that she sells these animals in the local market or to wholesale buyers of animals. It should be emphasized that Francisca has 8 years of experience, which has allowed her to maintain already established customers in this business.

Now Francisca has proposed increasing her inventory with regard to the fattening and sale of animals (sheep and barnyard fowl), since it is a very profitable business in this area. It is because of these circumstances that she is applying to Edpyme Alternative for a new loan in the amount of 800 PEN, which will be destined for the purchase of balanced feed to fatten the animals and improvements in their corrals. In time this will allow her to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten her animals and improve their pens.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 23-year-old man. He’s single and lives in Lebanon with his parents and five siblings. Hasan's father is the one responsible for his wife and children’s needs. As for Hasan, his hobby was to make wood carvings until he decided to make it his own business. He opened his own shop in 2005 and is looking forward to making better designs. Today, he’s asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of wood for his business. He notes that this will increase his productivity and thus his sales. In the future, he plans to expand his business and make his own exhibits.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of wood for his business.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is a prospective student applying for a loan to start work on a Bachelor's degree in Telecommunications at Strathmore University and this is his story:

My name is Sammy. I am from Nairobi, Kenya. I was born second in a family of four siblings including two brothers and two sisters: an elder sister named Berryl; a younger sister called Tinna, currently in her third form in secondary school; and Gabriel, the last born of the family, who is a standard 8 candidate at primary school.

I chose Strathmore University because I believe that it is the institution that will offer me the best opportunity for quality education. I draw inspiration from my elder sister, who is an alumnus of the University; her colleagues who went to Strathmore with her, and my former classmates who are currently studying at Strathmore. They motivated me to seek admission to Strathmore University, and I am so grateful to God that I was granted entrance and will therefore commence my first year of study on June 25, 2012.

I am taking out this Kiva loan to fund my degree course through University. This is because my family is currently unable to pool enough resources to see me through my degree. Even though Strathmore University seems an expensive option given my family’s financial status, I do believe that education is a worthy and noble investment in one’s future, and not just an expense as some may perceive. 

My father, the family’s sole breadwinner, was rendered jobless along with thousands of others when his factory was shut down three years ago and placed under receivership. He now tries his hand at farming. He has established a small tree seedling nursery. He uses the returns to look after the family’s welfare and contribute to my siblings' school fees. My mother, who has been a hairdresser for almost 15 years now, uses her meager earnings to feed the family. My elder sister Berryl, who is currently juggling school and work, is the one who helped my parents put me through secondary school. She is also financing my younger siblings’ education and paying her own fees for a degree course. Her finances are stretched far too thin to pay for my university fees. This has left me with a Kiva loan as my only option of getting a chance to study at university.

At Strathmore, I wish to pursue a Bachelor's degree in Telecommunications, which will enable me to achieve my dream career in the field of Information Technology. This is something that has kept me motivated and inspired me to put in the effort needed to excel in my secondary school education. I want to pursue a leading career in the ICT sector after I graduate from my course, and I hope to make a positive contribution to the development of Kenya. It is through ICT that Kenya can follow the path toward attaining its visions and goals. I also hope that I will be able to further my education and attain a Master's in the same field. I hope to also assist my younger siblings (and anybody else I can) to get the best education so that they may also have a successful and bright future. Furthermore, I am so grateful to the Kiva program as it seeks to help put needy students through school, ultimately leading the way toward raising a nation with fulfilled dreams – a nation which is successful, grateful, charitable and unified.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Telecommunications at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Hugo Guillermo

texts.es:
Hugo Guillermo tiene 37 años de edad es casado tiene cuatro hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.

Hugo Guillermo es maestro soldador. 
Solicita el crédito para  comprar ganado. Con el dinero podrá comprar dos ganados vacunos.  La compra lo hará en Machachi. El sueño es dar la educación a los hijos, y aumentar el ganado.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades del ganado. En el tiempo libre le gusta el deporte y disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
texts.en:
Hugo Guillermo is 37 years old and is married with four children. He lives with his wife and children in the Chillanes province of Bolívar.

Hugo Guillermo is a master welder. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase cattle. With the loan money he will be able to purchase two beef cattle in Machachi. 

His dream is to provide education for his children and to increase his cattle herd. Cattle diseases are one of the challenges he faces. In his free time, Hugo Guillermo likes sports and enjoying carnival activities.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en: Nada is a 47-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband. They have five children, four of whom are working and the other one is still attending school.  Her husband is the main source of income in the family and has big responsibilities to take care of. As for Nada, she has been working selling fruits and vegetables for the past twenty-three years; she has her own shop where she serves all the neighboring villages. Today, she’s requesting  a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional fruits and vegetables for her shop to be able to carry on her work properly. In the future, she plans to enhance her work and buy some land where she can cultivate all kinds of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables for her shop to be able to carry on her work properly

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en: Jaafar is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and four siblings, who are all working. His father and siblings strive to work under pressure in order to have a good way of living. And after many years of experience as a carpenter, Jaafar decided to open his own carpentry business in 2004. He’s a reputable man who has gained a fair number of loyal customers despite his young age. Today, he is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed quantity of wood for his work. He notes that this will improve his business and thus boost his productivity. In the future, he plans to take on bigger projects outside the country.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of wood for his work

loans.name: Naranchimeg

texts.en: Naranchimeg, 30, works as a janitor in the public theater. She lives with her husband in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. Her monthly salary usually does not cover her necessities and she wants to start saving for her family. This time she is requesting a loan to purchase seeds to plant vegetables on her plot of land. Before, she took a loan to run a retail business and repaid her loan successfully on time.

loans.use: To purchase seeds to plant vegetables on her plot of land.

loans.name: Candelario Noe

texts.es:
Candelario tiene 22 años de edad, tiene una compañera de vida. Él se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura junto con su papá, desde hace 6 años que se dedica a la ganadería. Con su propio esfuerzo compro una vaca y de esa vaca hoy tiene 8 más.  

Para comprar el concentrado para las vacas, se traslada a la ciudad que esta ha veinticinco minutos a pie, después aborda un autobús que tarda media hora. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando Candelario es para comprar una vaca parida y un toro, por que tiene 8 vacas y no tiene toro y son 98,000 metros cuadrados de terreno que quiere aprovecharlo al igual que su juventud. 

Al realizar el financiamiento se le mejorara en todos los ámbitos, ya que candelario manifiesta que dispondrá del sustento diario por medio de las vacas y de esa manera ofrecerá a su esposa una vida digna. 

Él menciona que si Dios lo bendice planea arreglar adecuadamente el terreno y tener tres hijos con su esposa y quiere estar preparado cuando eso pase, tanto económicamente como emocional para no tener problemas a futuro.
texts.en:
Candelario is 22 years old and is in a relationship. He has worked for the past 6 years with his father in agriculture and cattle-raising. By his own means he bought a cow and from that cow he now has 8 more. To purchase the cow feed, he travels 25 minutes by foot to the city and then takes a 30-minute bus ride. 

Candelario is requesting this loan to purchase a calved cow and a bull. He has 8 cows and no bull, and he wants to take advantage of both his youth and his 98,000 square meters of land.

Upon receiving this funding, things will improve for Candelario in all aspects. He states that with these cows he will provide daily food and will thus offer his wife a decent life.  

Candelario mentions that with God's blessing he plans to adequately fix the land and have three children with his wife. He wants to be prepared when this happens, both economically and emotionally, to avoid problems in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a calved cow and a bull.

loans.name: Tabitha M.

texts.en:
Tabitha is 27 years old, from Nakuru and is married with one daughter who is 7 years old.

Tabitha has a hotel business that she has been doing for the past 4 years. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy chairs, tables and also cooking items like cooking fat, sugar etc.

She hopes to expand her hotel business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy chairs and tables.

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en: Wilberforce is 46 years old, married and has five children.  He has been operating a tailoring business for over ten years.  He has benefited from the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management skills. This has helped him in running his business.  His desire is to expand his business and employ more people. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is married with six children. She lives in Ntambessi, Cameroon. She lives with her entire family in a three-bedroom house. She has overcome difficulties like her daughter's sickness, which was for four years, difficulties in paying her rent, and she went as far as cooking with no cooking oil.

This will be the 7th time Anna is benefiting from a loan from GHAPE.  Anna has been in GHAPE since August 2002 and has been very successful in past businesses. She uses her house for the business and this keeps her from paying rent elsewhere.

Anna plans to buy firewood, decoration materials and to pay for transportation. She says that this business will help the community in that they will get firewood very cheap from her.

She intends to use the proceeds of this business to pay her children's school fees, buy some basic needs for the family, and save some with the credit union.

loans.use: to pay for firewood, transportation and decoration materials

loans.name: Elvita

texts.en: Elvita, 51 years old, is from the village of Luna, province of Isabela. A hardworking and loving mother of three grown children, she is engaged in making rice cake and other pastries. She is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy additional raw materials that she can use to make rice cake and other pastries to sell in the community. In the future, Elvita hopes that she can expand her business so that she can sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, coconut and beverages for her business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is married with five children. She lives in Mile 3 Nkwen, Cameroon. She lives with her entire family in a three-bedroom house.

Her brother's death was one of the most difficult moments in her life. Thieves have broken into her house and pigs have been stolen from her pig sty. She also has had difficulty paying her rent.   

Alice has benefited from six prior loans from GHAPE. Alice has been in GHAPE since 2002 and has been very successful in past businesses. 

She plans to use her loan to purchase and resell second-hand dresses. She thinks her business will succeed because she has so many customers and also because people in her community prefer second-hand dresses since they are cheaper.   

She intends to use the proceeds of this business to pay her children's school fees and to buy some basic needs for the family. She also wants to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to pay for second-hand dresses, rent, and transportation.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es:
Nery  es un hombre  que tiene  32 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, además  cuenta con 02 hijos que son menores de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijo en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Nery  vive en casa propia en el  caserío La Estancia del distrito de Olmos, departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este distrito viven aproximadamente unas 90  familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Nery es al transporte público de mototaxi el recorrido lo realiza entre las zonas de La Estancia  – Olmos y visciversa. Su cónyuge es técnica enfermera donde viene trabajando en el centro de salud de esa zona, donde percibe otros ingresos que lo apoya en la canasta familiar; cabe destacar que en esta actividad  de transporte público Nery cuenta con 04 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. Además Nery también se dedica a la agricultura donde tiene sembrado cultivos de maíz y leguminosas.
Actualmente Nery esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 2500 nuevos soles que será para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo y compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo de maíz, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Nery is a 32 year old man in a common-law marriage. He also has two younger children; he lives with his spouse and son in their own house. He says that the quality of life in his community is one of subsistence. The majority of residents are independent workers who work in business, agriculture, and raising livestock. Nery lives in his own house in the small village of La Estancia in the district of Olmos, Department of Lambayeque. As it is, he relies on basic electrical services; he also says that approximately 90 families in this district live under these conditions. 

Nery’s business activity is public transportation by moto-taxi. His route runs between the areas of La Estancia-Olmos and vice-versa. His wife is a nurse technician who works at the region’s health center, where she receives additional income that supports the family’s basic needs. Nery points out that he has 4 years of experience in public transportation, which has allowed him to maintain an established clientele in this business. Additionally, Nery works in agriculture, where he has planted corn and legumes.

Currently, Nery is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the amount of 2500 nuevos soles (PEN) to be put toward the maintenance of his vehicle and the purchase of fertilizer for growing corn. This a very profitable activity in the area, and in time, it will allow him to continue improving his standard of living with his family.

loans.use: to maintain his moto-taxi and to buy fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en: Florencio, 41, is married and has two school-age children. He is a very responsible father and husband. Florencio has operated a farm for 26 years. His wife Rosita manages a small store in the community. To earn additional income, Florencio is seeking a loan of PHP 22,000 to buy insecticides, fertilizer, and seed for his farming business. In the future, Florencio hopes to expand his business to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizer and seed for his business.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex, 35, is married and his wife is his highest priority. He is requesting a loan of PHP 24,000 to buy compost and herbicides, and to pay for labor to maintain and improve his rice field. Alex has plenty of experience in managing this crop. Based on his knowledge, he can obtain the best production results. He wants to take advantage of his crop so that he can provide for himself and his wife. Alex would like to secure his financial future because he currently has difficulty generating income. He is very confident that increasing his rice production will stabilize his financial situation.

loans.use: to buy compost and herbicides and to pay for labor to maintain his farm business.

loans.name: Melanio

texts.en:
Melanio is a 38-year-old man who has a partner with four school-aged children. He lives in a house with his family. This is located in the Luna province of Isabela. He says that his house only has electrical service.

He does agricultural work on the land around his house. His parents are great farmers and well-respected in the area.

He says that the income that he earns is not sufficient for his support. He decided to grow rice on land that he has inherited from his father. He can sell the rice after the harvest; this is why he is asking for this loan of 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP).

Melanio is an optimistic and friendly person. His goal is to build another business like a store.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for his business.

loans.name: Ignatius

texts.en:
Ignatius is married with five children and lives in Alabukam Cameroon. Ignatius and his family live in a five-room house. Ignatius had to overcome some challenges in life such as ill health, difficulties paying his children's school fees, and general poverty. He has a motor bike transport business to assist his family and reduce their poverty.

This would be his tenth loan from GHAPE and he has been a member since 1998. Ignatius has been quite successful in the past due to the location of his business, the high demand for his service, his experience in riding, and his maintenance of his bike.
 
Profits resulting from this loan will be used to take care of his children, buy necessities for the family, and give them good medication whenever they are sick. He will also reinvest profits in his transport business. 
 
He plans to buy a motor bike, pay for the documents, and also pay for fuel. He says that his business will succeed because he has been doing this activity for a very long time and only motor bikes are used in his area because of bad roads. His business will provide transportation for people in his community to travel to the urban centers of Bamenda.

loans.use: to pay for a motorcycle, documents, and fuel.

loans.name: Montaser

texts.en:
Montaser is a 22-year-old single man. He operates a pool table business to entertain customers and wants to expand it by opening a cafe to provide hot drinks to customers such as coffee, tea, and herbal drinks.

Montaser is requesting a USD $3,000 youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing necessary supplies for opening a cafe such as tables, chairs, cups, and trays. This will allow Montaser to prepare well for starting his project and provide his customers with the best service. This will lead to increased demand and improve Montaser's income.

loans.use: to purchase necessary supplies for opening a cafe.

loans.name: Edda Matilde

texts.es:
EL Banco Divino Niño Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Edda, tiene 50 años de edad, está separada pero  de esa relación tienen cinco hijos, 3 mayores de edad y dos de 16  y 14 años de edad que estudian en colegio, tres de sus hijos aun vive con ella, al igual que dos nietos de 7 y 3 años los cuales ya están en escuela y  están a su cargo.

Ella con la intención de ganarse la vida  y con esto poder salir adelante junto con sus hijos  se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene unas vitrinas, sus hijas le ayudan en sus ventas ya que llevan mercadería al colegio o les dicen a su compañeras para que  vayan a su casa a comprar alguna prenda. Trabaja todos los días a cualquier hora, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada 8 días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de 10 años  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos y gracias estos ella ha podido sacara delante a sus hijos.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Divino Niño Jesús" (Divine Christ Child) meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa, which is known by its nickname "The Sultana of Coffee" because of its extensive coffee crop that has an incomparable flavor. This area is also known for its food and the warmth of its people.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Edda. She is 50 years old, separated from her spouse, and has five children. Three of them are grown and the other two (ages 16 and 14) are high school students. Three of her children live with her, as well as two grandchildren (ages 7 and 3) who are in elementary school and under her care.

Edda intends to earn a living so that she and her children can get ahead. She is a merchant who sells all types of clothing. Edda generates her sales by going door-to-door, but she also sells from her home since that is where she has a few display cases. Her daughters help with her sales and even deliver merchandise to their school. They often come home saying that their classmates want to buy some article of clothing. Edda works every day around the clock. She extends credit to her customers and collects payment every eight days. Her merchandise is purchased in Guayaquil as needed. She has been in this business for three years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing. Edda has been with her Communal Bank for more than 10 years and enjoys being a member because of the help that the loans have given her. As a result, she has been able to help her children move forward. Her dream is to see her children finish their studies and become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Pedro Julio

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre que tiene 30  años de edad, de estado civil soltero sin hijos,  vive  en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Pedro vive en  el caserío Tùpac Inca Yupanqui del distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de  Piura, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Pedro es la crianza de ganado vacuno y venta de leche  y aves de corral , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Pedro cuenta con 04 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; él  vende su leche en el mercado de Tambogrande; Así mismo también se dedica a su chacra donde tiene instalado  0.5  has de cultivo de limón lo cual presenta buen estado fenològico y donde viene realizando cosechas semanalmente, de donde le permite tener otros ingresos. 
Actualmente Pedro se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de leche, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.2000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceado y fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 30-year-old man, single with no children and lives in a house he owns.  The quality of life in his community is at a subsistence level, where majority of the inhabitants are independent workers that work in commerce and farming of livestock as well as agriculture.

Pedro lives in the Tupac Inca Yupanqui neighborhood of the district of Tambogrande in the department of Piura, he only has basic electricity service, the rest of the families that live there have the same services.

His commercial activity is the farming of cattle and poultry as well as milk sales.  He performs his farming activities in exterior barns different from his home address; it's important to point out that Pedro has four years of experience doing this activity, which has allowed him to maintain an established client base; he sells the milk at the Tambogrande market; he also works in agriculture where he has half a hectare of lime trees, which represents their good crops and where he picks limes weekly and is able to obtain other income.  

At the moment Pedro has proposed himself expand his inventory of livestock and milk, because it's a profitable activity in the area.  This is why he requests a new loan from Edpyme Alternative for 2,000 new soles which will be invested in buying feed and fertilizer, which with time will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Emiterio

texts.en:
Emiterio is 53 years old. He lives in Sta. Isabel village, province of Isabela with his wife with three children. Emiterio runs a farm of 2.8 hectares where he cultivates rice and corn crops. Emiterio's wife and mother help him with the daily agricultural activities. He has been involved in farming for 12 years.

Emiterio has applied for this loan for land cultivation. With the help of this loan, he plans to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Emiterio is full of hope that he will gather a rich harvest and get increased income from its sales. With additional income, he plans to renovate his house and create more prosperous conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his business

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 42 years old, from Santa Isabel, province of Isabela and is married with three grown children.

Wilson is a farmer and has been in it for the past 18 years. He has applied for his loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to enable him to buy fertilizers, seedlings and pesticides for his farm.

He hopes to buy more farm inputs and increase his production and sales in order to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seedlings and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Severino

texts.en:
Severino is a very hardworking person. He started working from a very early age alongside his father who taught him how to farm. Currently, he works independently and has his own field. He managed to get it going with much effort and produces good quality products.

Thanks to his father’s teachings about farming, Severino has very good work habits. This has allowed him to win over many customers, which in turn has led to his continued growth. Because he started his farm with very little capital, he is looking for financing to buy manure, insecticide and fungicide to continue producing his own crops.

In this way, Severino will be able to continue generating income needed to support his family and making progress in life. In addition, he will be able to reach his great dream little by little of having a great business and generating employment for those who are most needy.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticide and fungicide.

loans.name: Riezl-Grace

texts.en:
Riezl-Grace,19 years old, is a very young entrepreneur, and a single woman. She lives in Sta. Isabel, province of Isabela. She is a very loving daughter. She supports all the needs of her parents, and also she saves for her future. Riezl-Grace is asking for a loan of PHP 22,000 to buy fertilizer, insecticides and seeds to grow for her farming business. 

In the future, Riezl-Grace hopes that her business will expand so that she can save for her future and support her parents' need.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and seeds to grow for her farming business

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is a very industrious person who has fought hard to move his wife and five children forward. He learned how to farm at a very early age, thanks to which he obtained work in some of the fields near his house. Since then, he has been working as a farmer. At first, this enabled him to have an income to contribute financially to his parent’s household, and later, to pay the expenses of his own home where he lives with his wife and children.

His farm is known for producing high quality products. This has enabled him to have a large number of established customers and very good sales every harvest. With the goal of continuing to produce his crops, Ruben is looking for a loan to provide the means of purchasing fertilizer, fungicides and insecticides to maintain his fields.

In this way, he will continue to have a high quality business that generates a very good income from his products. As well, he hopes that his business will grow and continue consolidating so that his family will have a better quality of life and greater opportunities to succeed economically.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, fungicides and insecticides for his business.

loans.name: Fahmi

texts.en:
Fahmi is a 22-year-old young man. He is married and has one son. He is a worker and earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Fahmi wants to improve his family's living conditions, so he is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing new home furniture such as bedroom furniture for his child and dining room furniture. This will enable Fahmi to improve his house's furniture and his family's living conditions. Fahmi is photographed sitting in his living room inside his house.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Astarico

texts.en:
Astarico is 29 years old, from Nakuru, and is married with one daughter who is two years old.

Astarico has a charcoal and a motorcycle business that he has been running for the past four years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy 20 bags of charcoal to add to his stock for sale.

He hopes to own many motorbikes in the future and employ people to enable him to run that business.

loans.use: To buy 20 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Mays

texts.en:
Mays is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Mohammad appears in her Kiva profile photo, in a picture inside his store.

Mays is a 24-year-old young woman. She is married to Mohammad and a mother to two sons and one daughter. Her husband works in agriculture. In addition he has a store for selling bicycles to customers, which has become a profitable project, but needs more support to cover the costs.

Mays is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband Mohammad cover the costs of purchasing a collection of bicycles to sell. This will offer to customers a better collection to choose from and buy, which will help to increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a collection of bicycles to sell

loans.name: Nahed

texts.en: Nahed is a 23-year-old who lives with his family in Hebron. He has a grocery store business and earns approximately $540 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a youth loan of $3000 for additional business capital and to purchase a variety of products. Nahed hopes to improve his living conditions by using his profit.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products and get additional business capital.

loans.name: Dufatanye Nº4/ Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Augustin fait partie du groupe Dufatanye No 4. Il a 31 ans, il est marie avec 2 enfants de 8 mois à 4 ans. Il a 2 personnes en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Augustin est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de demander d’autre crédit pour financer son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, Augustin voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire et médicaux pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Augustin is a member of the Dufatanye 4 group. He is 31 years old, married, and has two children between 8 months and 4 years. He has two other dependents apart from his children. His educational level is six years of primary school.

Augustin is  a rice farmer. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and pay the cost of labor.

His business strategy is to keep taking out loans to finance his agricultural enterprise. In the years to come, Augustin would like to become the best rice farmer in the region. He plans to use his revenues to pay for the education and healthcare of his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay the cost of labor.

loans.name: Ragheb

texts.en:
Ragheb is a 38-year-old married man with five children, who lives in a village in Hebron. He is hardworking and for 2 years he has been in the clothing business.

His personal goal is to educate his children and build a house in the near future. He hopes to expand his business and be well known in his town. He intends to use the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina  es una mujer que tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con dos hijo (o7 y 10 años) y su cónyuge en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Agustina vive en casa propia en el caserío Miraflores del distrito de Zaña del  departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artesanal. Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Agustina es el comercio, crianza, engorde  y venta de  animales menores como: aves de corral ,porcinos, caprinos y ovinos, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización de estos la realiza ya sea en el mercado local y/o ha compradores mayoristas de animales, cabe destacar que en esta actividad Agustina cuenta con 8 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. Así mismo su cónyuge le apoya en este tipo de negocio, donde poseen una buena relación familiar.
Actualmente Agustina se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la comercialización, engorde y venta de animales (porcinos, ovinos, caprinos y aves de corral), esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 1000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado  a la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde, y arreglo de corrales para sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Agustina, 45, lives with her common-law husband and two children, ages 10 and 7, in their own house.  It is stated that the quality of life in the community is one of survival.  Most of the people here are independent workers who raise and sell small animals.  Some of them are also farmers.  Agustina lives in her own house in the rural area of Miraflores in the distric of Zaña, department of Lambayeque.  Here the only utility they have is electricity.  For drinking water they must go to an artesian well.  All the families here live in the same conditions.

Agustina raises and sells small animals such as chickens, pigs, goats and sheep.  She raises them in corrals outside her house.  She sells them at local market or through wholesale livestock buyers.  Agustina has been in this business for eight years, which has allowed her to maintain a stable clientele.  Her husband helps with the business and they have a good family relationship.

Currently, Agustina is aiming to increase her livestock and sales (pigs, sheep, goats and chickens), since it is a profitable business in the area.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to buy balanced animal feed, and also to renovate the corrals for the livestock.  This will allow her to improve her family's lifestyle over time.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed and renovate the corrals.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 24 years old and a married woman. She is a mother of 2 children. She lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan.

Mariam is looking to have a loan of 500 JDs to expand her project in trading in babies' cotton diapers, which she sews, to increase her income. She will buy more raw material to make cotton diapers.

Mariam is under 30 years old so her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make babies' cotton diapers

loans.name: Ana Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Ana tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo con quien trabaja muy fuerte en la elaboración de artesanías (tejer hamacas). Desde pequeña, ella aprendió el oficio y también vende pupusas para obtener otros ingresos económicos.

Ana junto con su esposo van a comprar los insumos cada quince días, como lo son el hilo para tejer las hamacas, viaja en transporte público durante tres horas. 

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar dos cajas de hilo que cuesta $300 cada uno y aumentar la producción de hamacas. Ella las vende en una ciudad del oriente del país en donde tiene sus clientes y manifiesta que le es muy rentable. Con la inversión ella desea que sus ingresos económicos mejoren al igual que su condición de vida. 

Ana  desea comprar un vehiculo para trasportar la mercadería y también para venderla en la comunidades cercanas.
texts.en:
Ana, 46, and her husband work hard making crafts (hammocks).  She learned the craft as a young girl, and also sells pupusas (stuffed tortillas) for extra income.

Ana and her husband buy supplies, such as cord, for their hammocks every 15 days.  They take public transporation that lasts three hours.

She is in need of a loan to buy two boxes of cord, at a cost of $300 each, to increase hammock production.  She sells them in a city in the eastern part of the country where she has customers and sales are more profitable.  With this investment she hopes to improve her economic income as well as her lifestyle.

Ana would like to buy a vehicle to transport her goods and also sell them in closer communities.

loans.use: To buy two boxes of cord, at a cost of $300 each, to increase her hammock production.

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en:
Sabreen is 20-year-old married woman. She lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan. 

Sabreen is looking to have a loan of 500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) so she can improve her home living conditions to be more healthy, she will fix and repair it where needed. 

Sabreen is under 30 years old so her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to improve her house living conditons

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa  es una mujer que tiene 31  años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con tres hijos a su cargo, vive con su novio en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Josefa vive en  el caserío Santa Rosa del distrito de Las Lomas del  departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 100 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Josefa  es la venta de comida, Picantería y chicha en el cual atiende los  días viernes, sabados y domingos en un puesto del mercado de abastos de la zona, complementariamente se dedica a la crianza de animales menores  como Ovinos (cuenta con 20  animales) y aves de corral , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Josefa cuenta con 5 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ella vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo su novio también se dedica a su chacra donde tiene instalado  0.5  has de cultivo de limón lo cual presenta buen estado fenològico y también le apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente Josefa se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su negocio de picantería y venta de comida (menús), esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 1500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos para su negocio y alimento balanceado para sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir creciendo su negocio e ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Josefa, 31, lives with her boyfriend and their three children their own house.  It is stated that the quality of life in the community is one of survival.  Most of the people here are independent workers who raise and sell small animals, and some are also farmers.  Josefa lives in the Santa Rosa rural community in the district of Las Lomas in the department of Piura.  The only utility they have is electricity.  Approximately 100 families live in this community under these conditions.

Josefa earns a living selling food and chicha (corn-based drink) at her stall in the wholesale market, which she opens on Friday, Saturday and Sunday.  She also raises small animals such as sheep (she has 20) and chickens.  She has outdoor corrals at home.  Josefa has five years' experience which has allowed her to maintain her established customer base.  She sell animals to the wholesale merchants in the area.

Also, her boyfriend grows lemons on a patch of land he has and he also helps her in her business, so there is a good family relationship between them.

Currently, Josefa wants to increase the inventory at her food stall, since it is a profitable business in the area.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN to buy food for the business, as well as balanced feed for her animals.  Over time this will allow her to expand her business and improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy goods for her food stall, and balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
Mario es un hombre muy trabajador, vive al lado de su pareja y su hija de 3 años de edad, a la cual quiere muchísimo y también da la vida por darle una vida digna y que sea feliz, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor y sobre todo porque allí se desarrolla la agricultura así como también se encuentra la laguna de Huacachina la cual es visitada por muchos turistas en todo el año; como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Tallarín con Carapulcra”.

Día a día Alberto se dedica a su negocio como Maestro constructor; el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas diarias y atiende a 1 cliente en el día ya que depende del tamaño de la obra que realice; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo que realiza un buen acabado por ello los clientes siempre lo recomiendan.

Mario está muy agradecido una vez más con los prestatarios Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su valioso apoyo, con esta ayuda el podrá comprar maderas para la realización de sus obras y también comprar herramientas como picos, palas, entre otros; así el podrá seguir trabajando día a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño: Tener una gran empresa constructora”.
texts.en:
Mario is a hard worker who lives with his partner and three-year old daughter, who he loves very much and will do anything for in order to give her a decent life and make her happy.  His house is located in the city of Ica which is known for its warm and welcoming climate, and especially because of its agriculture and the Huacachina Lagoon which is visited by many tourists every year.  Like every good Peruvian, he likes the country's typical dishes and one of his favorites is the delicious "Tallarín con Carapulca" stew. 

Every day Alberto attends to his business as a master builder.  He spends about 10 hours a day and attends to one customer daily, depending on the size of the job he must do.  He believes business is going well because he is so responsible and good at what he does, so his customers always recommend him.

Mario is very grateful once again to Kiva lenders, since this is the second time he is receiving their support.  With this help he will be able to buy the wood he needs for his work, and also buy tools such as picks and shovels, among other items.  This will allow him to continue working daily toward his main goal: "To have a construction company".

loans.use: To buy wood and tools.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther es socia del Bancomunal Imasumacc, tiene 23 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo, y es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años. Ella durante el tiempo que pertenece a su Bancomunal ha logrado  hacer amistad con sus demás compañeras y compartir experiencias diferentes. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, ella es una joven emprendedora capaz de enfrentar cualquier situación que se le presente en la vida. Está agradecida con FINCA Perú porque aprendió a ahorrar su dinero, y con las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal pudo aprender a trabajar correctamente y  hacer buena inversión de su dinero. El préstamo que solicita lo  invertirá en la compra de cosméticos para su negocio.
texts.en: Esther is a member of the communal bank "Imasumacc".  She is 23 years old, has a son and has been a member of FINCA Perú for two years.  In the time since she joined the communal bank she has made friends with the other members, who have shared their different experiences.  She sells cosmetics by catalogue, and is a young entrepreneur who is capable of handling any situation that may arise in life.  She is grateful to FINCA Perú for teaching her how to save money.  Through the training received from her communal bank she learned how to work and invest her money well.  The loan she is requesting is to buy cosmetics for her business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 34 years old and is married with five children between 1 and 13 years old. She also takes care of 3 dependents. She sells various goods such as vacuum flasks, fanta, sugar, biscuits, etc. She currently employs one person to help her and she has 2 years of experience in this work. 

William has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as vacuum flasks, fanta, sugar, biscuits, etc., to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as: vacuum flask, fanta, sugar, biscuits etc to sell.

loans.name: C 4925 Twungubumwe Group

texts.en:
Elissa is 25 years old and is married with one child who is one year old. He owns a computer business and his business is open from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. seven days per week. Elissa is the leader of the group called "C 4925 TWUNGUBUMWE" in the local language which in English means "TO BE TOGETHER." 

Elissa is the second person from left in the photo above. He currently employs one person to help him and he has one year of experience in this work. 

Elissa has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more computers for re-sale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and to re-invest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more computers for re-sale.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 33 years of age and has three school-age children. For income, her husband drives a motorcycle for transport and Myrna raises pigs. She intends to strengthen these businesses in order to support the needs of her three children. However, she faces insufficiency of funds.

For this reason, Myrna is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase feed and vitamins for the pigs, and to perform maintenance on the motorcycle. She is hoping that her loan will help her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs and to maintain her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is a 30-year-old married man, a father with two sons who lives with his family in Gaza.

For the past three years, Husam has been running a grocery store, which has been a profitable project. His dream is to expand his store and turn it into a supermarket.

Husam asked Ryada for a $1,000 youth loan to help him cover the cost of purchasing a variety of products and groceries for sale such as rice, milk, sugar and cooking oil. This will enable Husam to offer customers all the types of groceries they often request, which will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase products and groceries for his mini market

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac, a father of three school-going children, has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town. It has been profitable, thereby enabling him to provide for his family's needs. Besides farming as his primary activity, he also owns a bakery and sells bread to various traders and customers in the area.

He plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer and spraying chemicals for use on his farm during this planting season, and part of the loan amount to boost his bakery business by adding more stock of baking flour and oil.

In the future, Isaac hopes to grow his farming and venture into large scale farming, as well as expand the bakery business by supplying bread to other areas and thereby make more income and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and spraying chemicals

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 51-year-old man. He is married and a father to five sons. He is a worker with a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past seven years, Khalil has also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project, but he also needs more support to cover the costs.

Khalil is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and expanding and improving the herd's condition. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

Kahlil is photographed next to the herd.

loans.use: to improve the project and increase number of sheep he has

loans.name: Essam

texts.en:
Essam is 25 years old. He has been a DJ for 2 years. He has a stereo. The customers in his town call him for wedding parties or any occasion that they want to celebrate. His project is distinct because of his good performance.

Essam needs this youth loan to buy an extra stereo, which will attract his customers; this will increase his income for him to pay for his brother's education.

loans.use: to buy an extra stereo for his DJ equipment

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, membre du groupe de crédit  Ukweli, Femme  dynamique, entrepreneur, âgée de 31 ans, mère de 8 enfants. Elle est  vendeuse des divers. En plus, elle vend aussi des beignets, Primus, Fanta, etc. a son domicile pour accroitre ses revenus. Son mari est un quincailleur. Elle commença son business vers les années 2003 avec de fonds propres reçu de son mari.  Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et scolarité pour ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  14eme  cycle de crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Ainsi, elle a décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  5 casiers de Primus, 3 casiers de Fanta, 1 ballon de Friperies, etc.  En plus, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle dans le futur. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu. Il sied de signaler une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
The customer is a member of the Ukwell lending group. She is a 31-year-old dynamic entrepreneur and the mother of 8 children. Her husband is a hardware dealer.

She sells various products, as well as doughnuts, Primus and Fanta from her home to increase her income. She started her business around 2003 using funds received from her husband. The profits from her business are used to build savings and pay for her children's food and education.

She has received her 14th loan. Over time, this customer has seen her business prosper positively; she has therefore decided to increase the amount of her latest loan for this cycle. The loan will be used to buy 5 cases of Primus, 3 cases of Fanta, 1 bale of second hand clothing, etc. Eventually, she would also like to buy a plot of land.

The customer thanks Hekima for its actions to empower women with lower incomes.
Note: one customer in the group picture is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to buy 5 cases of Primus, 3 cases of Fanta, 1 bale of second hand clothing, etc.

loans.name: Mawussi

texts.fr:
Mawussi est une femme âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 3 enfants, dont 2 à l’école. Le premier a 10 ans et le dernier a 2 ans.
Mawussi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1991. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Mawussi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Mawussi voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’associer des membres de sa famille afin qu'ils s'épanouissent eux aussi
texts.en:
Mawussi is a 39-year-old woman. She is married to a driver. She has 3 children, 2 of whom attend school. The eldest child is 10 years old and the youngest 2.

Mawussi has been working as a retailer since 1991. She sells grocery products from her home to all types of customers. She gets the products in Lomé and works alone. Currently, her principal problem is a lack of inventory.

Mawussi has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy grocery products; she wishes to reinvest in her business. In the years ahead, she would like to increase the size of her business. She plans to use the profits to involve other family members in the business, so that they can flourish too.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Davi

texts.fr:
Davi est une femme âgée de27 ans. Elle est mariée å un plombier. Elle a 1 enfant de 10 qui va à l’école.
Davi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006. Elle vend du riz Thaïlandais pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est le manque de stock.
Davi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du riz Thaïlandais. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Davi voudrait ouvrir d’autres boutiques. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de s’acheter un moyen de transport et réaménager son logement.
texts.en:
Davi is 27 years old. She is married to a plumber and has a 10-year-old child who goes to school.

Davi has been working as a retailer since 2006. She sells Thai rice in her shop to all types of customers. She gets her supplies in Lomé and works alone. Right now, her main difficult is a lack of inventory.

Davi has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy Thai rice; she wishes to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Davi would like to open other shops. She plans to use her profits to buy a means of transportation and to refurbish her accommodation.

loans.use: to buy Thai rice.

loans.name: Zihué

texts.fr:
Zihuè est une femme âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée à un carreleur. Elle a 3 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 15 ans et le dernier a 6 ans.
Zihuè travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend des mèches et des foulards pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Zihuè a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Zinhè voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Zihuè is a 48-year-old woman. She is married to a tiler. She has 3 children who all attend school. The eldest is 15 years old and the youngest 6.

Zihuè has been working as a retailer since 2007. She sells hair extensions and scarves at the market to all types of customers. She gets her supplies in Lomé and works alone. Currently, her biggest difficulty is her lack of stock.

Zihuè has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy hair extensions; she wishes to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, she would like to expand the size of her business. She plans to use her profits to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and scarves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en:
Revaz is 58 years old. He lives in a small village of the Gardabani district with his wife, Irina, and a sister. Revaz is a worker in the village. Along with the above mentioned he works on a family agricultural farm. The family has a dairy farm with 9 milk cows. Revaz, his sister and Irina produce cheese and sell it on the Gardabani Market. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris. 

Revaz requested credit for purchasing piglets and feed for them. Revaz will grow piglets and sell grown pigs by early winter for a higher price. The family will get a profit. Revaz will reinvest it in the same business and purchase more piglets. In the long term, the income of the family will increase and they will be able to purchase necessary consumer goods to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase piglets.

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en: Hesham is 25 years old and he is from Gaza. In 2011, Hesham opened an electronic products store where he sells wires, cables, and other peripherals. He is taking out this youth loan to install shelves and change the decor in his store. He wants to carry more products and attract more customers. His project is successful because it’s the only one in the area.

loans.use: to install shelves and change the decor.

loans.name: Dafou

texts.fr:
Dalou est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée å un électricien. Elle a 1 enfant de 15 ans qui va à l’école.
Dalou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006. Elle vend du charbon de bois pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Dalou a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Dalou voudrait élargir l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Dalou is a 31-year-old woman. She is married to an electrician and has a 15-year-old child who goes to school.

Dalou has been working as a retailer since 2006. She sells charcoal door to door to all types of customers. She gets her supplies in Lomé and works alone. Currently, her principal difficulty is her lack of inventory.

Dalou has requested her 4th loan from WAGES in order to buy charcoal; she wishes to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, she would like to expand her business. She plans to use the profits to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 29 years old, from Nyahururu, and is married to Alice. They have one son who is four years old.

James has a bicycle repair business that he has been operating for the past 14 years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more spare parts so as to offer good service to his customers.

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr:
Ayawa est une femme âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée å un employé. Elle a 1 enfant âgé de 5 ans qui va à l’école.
Ayawa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2002. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Ayawa a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ayawa voudrait agrandir la taille de l’activité et vendre en gros. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en:
Ayawa is a 34-year-old woman. She is married to a worker and has one 5-year-old child who goes to school.

Ayawa has been working as a retailer since 2002. She sells grocery products in her shop to all types of customers. She gets her supplies in Lomé and works alone. Currently, her main problem is that she is unable to satisfy all her customers' demands.

Ayawa has requested her 3rd loan from WAGES in order to buy grocery products; she wishes to reinvest in her business. In the years ahead, she would like to increase the size of her business and start selling wholesale. She plan to use her profits to secure an education for her child.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Manya

texts.en:
Manya is still running her food trading business. She keeps on buying dairy products and eggs from villagers, bread from a neighbor bakery and confectionery, canned goods and beverage foods from suppliers. Manya’s stall is situated near the food market’s entry where it is always crowded, and thanks to that, Manya has many customers. 

She used her previous Kiva loan to develop her stall assortment. Now she is asking for a 350,000 AMD loan to buy a large lot of dairy products and confectionery for her business.

loans.use: to buy a large lot of dairy products and confectionery for her business.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is 27 years old from Nakuru and is married to Stephen. They have one son who is six years old. 

Teresiah has a shoe business that she has been operating for the past two years, and has now applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy more shoes to add to her stock.

She hopes to open up a wholesale shop for shoes.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Duterimbere /nymgn Group

texts.fr:
Fulgence fait partie du groupe Duterimbere/Nymgn. Le nom du groupe signifie «progresser nous même». Il a 32 ans, il est marie avec 2 enfants de 3 ans à 6 ans, dont 1  scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Fulgence est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de demander d’autres crédits pour augmenter ses activités agricoles. Dans les prochaines années, Fulgence voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de construire une maison et payer les frais scolaire et médicaux pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fulgence is a member of the Duterimbere/Nymgn group. The name of the group means "advance ourselves". Fulgence is 32, married and has 2 children aged 3 and 6, one of whom attends school. Fulgence himself has 6 years of primary level education.

Fulgence is a rice farmer. This is his 2nd loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay the manual labourers. His strategy for the growth of his business is to request more loans so that he can increase his agricultural activities.

In the years ahead, Fulgence would like to be one of the best rice producers in his region. With the profits, he plans to build a house and pay his children's educational and medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay the manual labourers.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en: Sahar, a 40-year-old married mother of four children living in Gaza, started working as a seamstress in her own small shop in 2011. She is requesting a loan from Ryada to buy an electricity generator and new machines for her store. Sahar hopes that the loan will improve her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy an electricity generator and new machines for her store.

loans.name: Hijazi

texts.en:
Hijazi, a 49-year-old married father of four sons and four daughters, works in agriculture with two of his sons. For the past seven years, Hijazi has also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products on a farm suitable for this activity but located far away from home.

This has been a profitable project, but one that needs more support, so Hijazi is requesting a loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more sheep to raise and benefit from its products. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

Hijazi is photographed on the farm with his little son.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 34 years old. She is a single mother of five children, who are all school-going. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past seven years.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced by one of our field officers. She will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer, seedlings and spraying chemicals.

She hopes to become a top farmer in her area and manage to see her children through their education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings and spraying chemicals.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 29 years old from Nakuru, and he is married with two children who are 10 and 8 years old.

James has a polythene bags business that he has been operating for the past three years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more polythene bags to add to his stock.

He hopes to expand his business and be a wholesale supplier of polythene bags in Nakuru town.

loans.use: To buy polythene bags to add to his stock.

loans.name: Yurither

texts.en:
