Yurither had previously requested a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy flowers.  She was able to make good sales, hence more profits.  She was able to pay school fees with the additional income from her business.  She has also increased her savings. She hopes to export flowers in the future.

She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more flowers.

loans.use: to buy more flowers.

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter lives in the Gardabani District, East Georgia, with her 33-year-old son. Eter and her son earn their living through agriculture. They have a dairy farm with 3 milk cows. Eter produces cheese and sells it in Tbilisi. She takes cheese to the market once a week. They sell on average 50 kg of cheese per month. The total average monthly income of the family is 300 Laris, including Eter’s pension.

Eter requested credit for expansion of the dairy farm. She will purchase an additional milk cow, and will be able to produce 25% more cheese. Eter will sell additional cheese at the same market, where her product is quite popular among consumers. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron, a 33-year-old married man, has been operating a carpentry business to earn a living for over five years. He also does dairy farming for more income generation. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Haron has become more financially stable because he has managed to grow his business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya for their financial support through loans.

Haron is requesting a loan of 25,000 Kenya shillings to buy more timber. He hopes to open a big carpentry workshop in the future.

loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
For the past ten years, Joseph has been mining stones which he sells to his customers, and the business is doing well. Having repaid his previous loan well and in good time, he is now requesting his second one from KADET LTD. to purchase a dairy cow so his wife can commence dairy farming.

Joseph hopes to eventually own a large quarry that will help him finance his children's education.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 21-year-old single young man. His father is a worker who gets a low salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past eight years, Rani's family has also been operating this barber shop, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the costs.

Rani is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new barber kit and some necessary supplies, such as hair and face creams and hair shampoo. This will improve the quality of work and satisfy the customers, which will increase the amount of work and improve Rani's income.

He is photographed inside his barber shop.

loans.use: To purchase a new barber kit and some necessary supplies.

loans.name: Joselyn Stepanie

texts.es: Joselyn es social del Bancomunal Imasumacc, tiene 20 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo y es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años. Se dedica a la venta de postres como mazamorras y picarones, se siente muy orgullosa por todo lo que ha logrado conseguir con sus ahorros. Está muy agradecida con la institución por ofrecerle facilidades de crédito, capacitaciones con las cuales aprendió a invertir su dinero de manera adecuada. Su meta es construir su casa. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá  en la compra de ingredientes para los postres que prepara como maíz morado, harina, aceite, azúcar, pasas, leche.
texts.en: Joselyn is a member of the communal bank Imasumacc. She is 20 years old and has one son. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for the last two years. She makes a living selling desserts such as mazamorras and picarones, typical Peruvian desserts. She feels very proud of all she has achieved with her savings. She is very grateful to the MFI for helping her out with the credit loans, with which she has learnt to invest well. Her goal is to build her house. She will invest this loan in buying ingredients for the desserts she prepares such as purple corn, flour, oil, sugar, raisins, milk.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as purple corn, flour, oil, sugar, milk.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, a 33-year-old single mother of two school-going children, has been a dairy farmer for the past four years. Having repaid her previous loan well and in good time, Jane is requesting her second one from KADET LTD. to increase milk production through the purchase of another dairy cow.

Jane hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru and also manage to see her children through their education.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es socia del Bancomunal Imasumacc, tiene 67 años de edad, es madre de 9 hijos y es socia de FINCA Perú hace 5 años. Se dedica a la crianza de animales, está  satisfecha con todo lo que ha logrado, aprendió mucho con todas las capacitaciones recibidas en su Bancomunal y se siente muy agradecida con FINCA Perú. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos para sus animales.
texts.en: Julia is a member of the communal bank Imasumacc. She is 67 years old. She is a mother of 9 children and has been a member of FINCA Perú for the past five years. She makes a living raising animals. She is satisfied with everything that she has achieved. She learnt a lot from the training sessions she received in her communal bank and she is very grateful to FINCA Perú. She will invest this loan in buying feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha used her previous loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruits and vegetables.  Her business has improved and grown, enabling her to hire one employee, and she hopes to open another business outlet in the future. Martha is requesting a loan of 35,000 Kenya shillings to buy bananas, passion fruits, cabbages, potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.use: to buy bananas, passion fruits, cabbages, potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Anwaar

texts.en:
Anwaar is a 38-year-old married mother of two sons and four daughters, all of whom attend school. Her husband has a butcher shop, but his income is insufficient to cover the family's needs.

In order to help meet the family's costs and educational expenses, Anwaar opened a small grocery store two years ago. It has become a profitable enterprise, but needs more support to cover stock-purchasing costs.

Anwaar is therefore requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her purchase more groceries for her store. This will satisfy her customers' needs, help to increase sales, and improve the family's income.

Anwaar is photographed inside her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Turwanyinzara Group

texts.fr:
Damascène fait partie du groupe Turwanyinzara. Le nom du groupe signifie «Luttons contre la famine». Il a 33 ans, il est marie avec 4 enfants de 7 mois à 12 ans, dont 2  scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Damascène est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de demander d’autres crédits pour augmenter ses activités agricoles. Dans les prochaines années, Damascène voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de construire une maison et payer les frais scolaire et médicaux pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Damascène is a member of the Turwanyinzara group. The name of the group means "Let's fight famine". Damascène is 33 years old, married and has 4 children aged between 7 months and 12 years, 2 of whom attend school. Damascène himself has 6 years of primary level education.

Damascène is a rice farmer. This is his 3rd loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the manual labourers. His strategy for the growth of his business is to request other loans so that he can increase his agricultural operations.

In the coming years, Damascène would like to be one of the best rice producers in his region. He plans to use the profits to build a house and pay his children's educational and medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the manual labourers.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is 28 years old. She is married to Joshua and together they have two school-going children. She sells clothes and has been in this business for the past 12 years.

This is Roselyne's second loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET by a credit officer. She paid her previous loan on time. She will use the loan amount to buy more clothes for sale in her business.

Roselyne hopes to own a permanent place in which to sell clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Eddah

texts.en:
Eddah is 53 years old and from Nakuru, Kenya. She is married to Joseph. They have six children, between ages 10 and 30.

Eddah is a water distributor. She has been doing this for the past two years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy a water tank for water storage.

Eddah hopes to establish her own shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a water tank for her water distribution business.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 29 years old and married with two children. To earn a living, he sells clothes. He has employed three people in his business. 

With the income from his business, Jimmy is able to provide for his family. He also runs a posho mill so as to boost his income.  

Jimmy hopes to grow his business into a wholesale business in the future. He needs 100,000 KES to buy trousers and dresses to sell.

loans.use: To buy trousers and dresses to sell.

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
Perpetua is a widow with five children. She lives in the northwest region of Bamenda in Cameroon (Africa). She lives with her entire family in a two-bedroom house.

The passing away of Perpetua's husband was one of the most difficult moments in her life. Thieves broke into her house and pigs were stolen from her. She has had difficulty many times in paying her rent.   

Perpetua has benefited from loans from GHAPE two times previously. This will be her third loan from GHAPE. She has been in GHAPE since 2009 and has been very successful in her past businesses. 

Perpetua plans to use her loan for the purchase of palm wine, beer and seedlings. She thinks her business will succeed because she has so many customers and her beer store is situated in a good area in her community. Also, she has been doing this business for three years.

She intends to use the proceeds to pay her children's school fees, buy some basic necessities for her children and build a house.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works toward the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multifaceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy palm wine, beer and seedlings.

location.town: BEHIND PMI, BAMENDA, NORTH WEST REGION

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 41 years old and married to Eusilah, a business lady who sells vegetables to contribute income to the family. They are blessed with four children aged 22, 18, 14 and 4 years. Jonah has been a livestock trader for over 15 years, earning a monthly income of KES. 20,000.

He is now requesting a third loan of KES.70,000 from KADET LTD. to purchase livestock for resale. The anticipated profits will be reinvested in his business and help pay school fees for his children.

Jonah's dream is to prosper in business and live a better life.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for resale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles sells clothes to earn a living, and has one employee.  He also runs a mobile phone money transfer business to earn extra income.  Charles has benefited from Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills, and hopes to grow his business and open other outlets. He is now requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy more trousers, dresses and blouses for his business.

loans.use: to buy trousers, dresses and blouses.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas, age 47, is a married man who is blessed with eight children between the ages of 2 and 24.  He buys and sells livestock and has been in this business for more than 14 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 40,000.  

Thomas is now requesting his third loan for KES 85,000 from KADET LTD after repaying the previous one successfully. He hopes to use this amount to purchase livestock for resale. The earned profits will be used to pay his children's school fees and construct a permanent house for his family.  

Thomas dreams of expanding his business and improving his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for resale.

loans.name: Haguruka Dukore 13 B / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Alexianne fait partie du groupe Haguruka Dukore 13 B / RSZ. Le nom du groupe signifie «relever toi et travailler». Il a 37 ans, il est marie avec 6 enfants de 7 mois à 17 ans, dont 6  scolarises. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Alexianne est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de demander d’autres crédits pour augmenter ses activités agricoles. Dans les prochaines années, Alexianne voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire et médicaux pour ses enfants.


NB:La neuvième personne qui est invisible s'appelle INNOCENT porte la chemise blanche.
texts.en:
Alexianne is a member of the "Haguruka Dukore 13 B / RSZ" group. The name of the group means "Get up and work". Alexianne is 37 years old, married and has 6 children aged between 7 months and 17 years, 6 of whom attend school. 

Alexianne has 6 years of primary level education and is a rice farmer. This is his 3rd loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the manual labourers. His strategy for the growth of his business is to request other loans so that he can increase his agricultural activities.

In the coming years, Alexianne would like to be one of the best rice producers in his region. He plans to use the profits to pay his children's educational and medical expenses.

Note: the person on the photo with the white shirt who is not visible is called Innocent.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the manual labourers.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es socia del Bancomunal Imasumacc, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos y es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años.Ella vende gelatina de manera ambulatoria en distintos lugares de la ciudad y se siente exitosa por todo lo que ha logrado con su ahorro, gracias a ello pudo contar con un capital de trabajo para seguir emprendiendo, con las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal pudo aprender a trabajar, a invertir su dinero y a educar a sus hijos de manera correcta. Su meta es que sus hijos sean profesionales. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para su negocio como gelatina en polvo, azúcar, flan, leche.
texts.en: Nancy is a member if the communal bank Imasumcc. She is 34 years old and mother to three children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for the past three years. She sells jelly as a street vendor in various places in the city. She feels successful thanks to everything she has achieved with her savings. Due to this she was able to rely on work capital in order to continue her business. With the training sessions she receives in her communal bank she learnt to work, how to invest her money and how to educate her children correctly. Her goal is to see her children become professionals. She will invest this loan in buying ingredients for her business such as jelly powder, sugar, flans, milk.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as jelly powder, sugar, milk, flans.

loans.name: Margarita Marisol

texts.es: Margarita es socia del Bancomunal Imasumacc, tiene 37 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa para señoritas. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 4 años, ella aprendió a compartir, a ser solidaria, responsable, puntual, valores que nunca le enseñaron, agradece mucho por la ayuda inmediata que le brindaron, que esta dedicada a las mujeres de bajos recursos económicos, ella dice que les enseñan a trabajar y nunca desmayar. El préstamo que solicita ahora lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para señoritas que venderá en su negocio.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Imasumacc communal bank.  She is 37 years old, and she has one child.  She sells beauty products and young women’s clothes.  She has been a member of Finca, Perú for four years.  

She learned how to share, be supportive, responsible, and punctual.  These are values that no one ever taught her before.  She is very grateful for the prompt help that they gave her and that they are devoted to women with few financial resources.  She says they taught her to work and to never get discouraged.

She will use the loan she is now requesting to buy young women's clothing that she will sell in her business.

loans.use: to buy young women's clothing that she will sell in her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice, a 58-year-old single mother of two, has been selling bananas and milk for 30 years now, earning a monthly income of 33,000 shillings. Now requesting her first loan from KADET LTD. to purchase more milk for resale, she plans to build a house with the profits. In the future,  Alice wants to be able to live a happy life.

loans.use: to purchase more milk to sell.

loans.name: Abajyamugambi Musenyi / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Alphonse fait partie du groupe Abajyamugambi / Msny Rsz. Le nom du groupe signifie «ceux qui ont le même objectif ou le même direction». Il a 55 ans, il est marie avec 4 enfants de 21 ans à 28 ans, dont 3  scolarises. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Alphonse est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de demander d’autres crédits pour augmenter ses activités agricoles. Dans les prochaines années, Alphonse voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire et médicaux pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Alphonse is a member of the "Abajyamugambi / Msny Rsz"  group. The name of the group means "Those with the same goal or direction". Alphonse is 55 years old and married with 4 children aged between 21 and 28, 3 of whom have attended school. Alphonse is also responsible for a dependant other than his children.

Alphonse has 6 years of primary level education and is a rice farmer. This is his 3rd loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the manual labourers. His strategy for the growth of his business is to request other loans so that he can increase his agricultural operation.

In the coming years, Alphonse wants to be one of the best rice producers in his region. He plans to use the profits to pay his children's educational and medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the manual labourers.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es socia del Bancomunal Musuq Inti, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos, es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes y también cose  ropa de Huamanguina, es casada y es socia de FINCA Perú  hace más de 1 año, le gusta asistir  a las reuniones de su Bancomunal pues le brindan capacitaciones que le enseñan a manejar bien su negocio, también temas en el ámbito familiar y personal, gracias a FINCA Perú pudo mejorar su negocio, mejorar en la puntualidad y responsabilidad. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de telas para la elaboración de ropa de Huamanguina (justan, blusa, lliclla y otros).
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the communal bank Musug Inti. She is 43 years old, married and the mother of two children. She has a grocery store and she also 
sews and embroiders traditional Huamanguina clothing. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for more than a year. She likes to attend the meetings of the communal bank because they provide training that help her to run her business better and help her in her family and personal life as well. Thanks to FINCA Peru she has improved her punctuality and responsibility in her business. She will use the loan she has requested to buy material in order to sew and embroider Huamanguina clothing like blouses, shawls and other items.

loans.use: to buy material to sew blouses, shawls and other traditional Huamanguina clothing.

loans.name: Digna

texts.es: Digna es socia del Bancomunal Musuq Inti, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años, se dedica  a la venta de ropa para toda edad, lo que mas le gusta de FINCA Perú es el ahorro, que le ayudo a tener una mejor idea de cómo mejorar su negocio y además las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal le ayudan a mejorar su vida y su negocio, lo que más desea es progresar junto a sus hijos y que su vida pueda mejorar. Ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa variada para su negocio.
texts.en: Digna is a member of the Musuq Inti communal bank. She is 36 years old and the mother of two children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for two years and works selling clothes for people of all ages. What she likes best about FINCA Peru is her ability to save money, which helped her have a better idea how to run her business. She also likes the training that she receives, which help her to improve her life and her business. Digna really wants she and her children to get ahead and to have a better life. She will use the loan she has requested to buy a variety of clothing for her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her business

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe/rsz Group

texts.fr:
Samuel fait partie du groupe Abishyizehamwe /Rsz. Le nom du groupe signifie «ensemble comme une seul personne». Il a 42 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 3 ans à 15 ans, dont 4  scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Samuel est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de demander d’autres crédits pour augmenter ses activités agricoles. Dans les prochaines années, Samuel voudrait devenir le meilleur agriculteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de construire une maison, payer les frais scolaire et médicaux pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Samuel is a member of the Abishyizehamwe /Rsz group. The name of the group means "Together as one person". Samuel is 42 years old and married with 5 children aged between 3 and 15, 4 of whom attend school.

Samuel has 6 years of primary level education and is a rice farmer. This is his 2nd loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the manual labourers. His strategy for the growth of his business is to request other loans so that he can increase his agricultural operation.

In the years ahead, Samuel would like to be one of the best rice producers in his region. He plans to use the profits to build a house and pay his children's educational and medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the manual labourers.

loans.name: Melina

texts.es: Melina es socia del Bancomunal Solidaridad, tiene 27 años de edad, es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años, le gusta las Capacitaciones que recibe en si Bancomunal porque aprende a progresar en su negocio y como persona, aprendió a  ahorrar y a como invertir en su negocio, otras instituciones no le brindan esos servicios. Ahora también quiere invertir en otro negocio y el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una peladora y cortadora de papa  que luego venderá a las pollerías que requieren estas maquinas.
texts.en: Melina is a member of the communal bank Solidaridad. She is 27 years old and is the owner of a grocery store. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for the past two years. She likes the training sessions she receives in her communal bank because she learns to progress in her business and as a person. She learnt how to save and how to invest money in her business. Other institutions don't offer these services. Now she also wants to invest in another business and the loan she is requesting will be used to buy a potato peeling and cutting machine, which she will later sell to the poultry shops who need these machines.

loans.use: to buy potato peeling and cutting machines

loans.name: Bahombeho Group

texts.fr:
Jean Joram fait partie du groupe Bahombeho. Le nom du groupe signifie «Aide l’une à l’autre pour vivre». Il a 36 ans, il est marie avec 3 enfants de 6 mois à 5 ans, dont 1  scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Jean Joram est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de demander d’autres crédits pour augmenter ses activités agricoles. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Joram voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire et médicaux pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Joram is a member of the Bahombeho group. The name of the group means "Helping one another to live". Jean Joram is 36 years old and married with 3 children aged between 6 months and 5 years, 1 of whom attends school.

Jean Joram has 6 years of primary level education and is a rice farmer. This is his 2nd loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the manual labourers. His strategy for the growth of his business is to request other loans so that he can increase his agricultural activities.

In the coming years, Jean Joram would like to be one of the best rice producers in his region. He plans to use the profits to pay his children's educational and medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the manual labourers.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es: Florentina es socia del Bancomunal Imasumacc, tiene 52 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos. Florentina es socia de FINCA Perú hace 16 años, se dedica  la venta de verduras por mayor y también tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa. Ella agradece las enseñanzas que le impartieron en su Bancomunal, aprendió a valorarse, a trabajar sin desmayar, le encanta asistir a las reuniones de su Bancomunal porque para ella son muy importantes y se distrae un poco después de tanto trabajo, está muy feliz por las cosas que pudo lograr como persona y también el poder brindar una educación universitaria a una de sus hijas, ella dice que FINCA Perú tienen mucho que ver en sus logros. Florentina invertirá el préstamo en la educación universitaria de su hija.
texts.en:
Florentina is a member of the Imasumacc communal bank.  She is 52 years old, and she has three children.  Florentina has been a member of FINCA Perú for 16 years.  She sells wholesale vegetables, and she also has a small store in her house.

She is grateful for the courses that were provided to her in her communal bank.  She learned to have self-esteem and to work without getting discouraged.  She is delighted to go to her communal bank’s meetings because they are very important to her, and she enjoys it after so much work.

She is very happy about the things she has been able to achieve as a person.  She is also happy to be able to give one of her daughters a college education.  She says that FINCA Perú has a lot to do with her achievements.  

Florentina will use the loan for her daughter’s college education.

loans.use: to pay for for her daughter’s college education.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es socia del Bancomunal Musuq Inti, tiene 50 años de edad, es madre de cuatro hijos, es dueña de una panadería, es casada y es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años, a ella le gusta las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal donde aprende a ahorrar, a dirigir su negocio, a ser puntual, el  préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de  harina, azúcar, mantequilla y otros insumos para su panadería.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Musuq Inti communal bank.  She is 50 years old, and she has four children.  She owns a bakery.  She is married, and she has been a member of FINCA Perú for two years.

She likes the trainings that she gets in her communal bank.  She learns to save, to run her business, and to be punctual.

She will use the loan she is requesting to buy flour, sugar, and butter, among other supplies for her bakery.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and butter, among other supplies for her bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken and fish for her business

loans.name: Lourdes Isabel

texts.es: Lourdes es socia del Bancomunal Urpicha II, tiene la edad de 35 años, tiene una tienda donde vende artefactos y mercería, es madre de 3 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú hace más de 7 años, gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal logro hacer su casa e incremento su negocio, el préstamo  que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio de mercería como peines,pulseras,collares,relojes,carteras.
texts.en: Lourdes is a member of the Urpicha II Communal Bank. She is 35 years old and she has 3 children. She has a store where she sells knick-knacks and accessories. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for more than 7 years. Thanks to the trainings she has received from them, she was able to build her home and expand her business. She will use the loan she has requested to buy merchandise for her business, including combs, bracelets, necklaces, watches and wallets.

loans.use: to buy combs, bracelets, necklaces, watches and wallets.

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es: Fabiana es socia del Bancomunal Urpicha II, tiene 54 años de edad, ella es dueña de una tienda de juegos de billar, es madre de 5 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú hace más de 10 años, es casada, gracias a sus ahorro y capacitaciones que recibió en su Bancomunal ella pudo construir su casa  y progresar junto a su familia, el préstamo que solicita  lo invertirá en la implementación de su negocio como la compra de mesas y materiales de billar.
texts.en: Fabiana is a member of the Urpicha II communal bank. She is 54 years old and she is the owner of a billiards game store. She has 5 children and has been a member of FINCA Peru for more than 10 years. She is married. Thanks to her savings and the training she received from the communal bank, she has been able to build her house and help her family get ahead. The loan she is requesting will be used in the implementation of her business, by buying billiard tables and equipment.

loans.use: to buy billiard tables and materials.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela es socia del Bancomunal Solidaridad, tiene 25 años de edad, es dueña de un puesto en el mercado donde vende carne, es madre de 1 hijo, es socia de FINCA Perú hace más de 2 años,  le gusta asistir a las reuniones de su Bancomunal donde aprende la puntualidad y le gusta aun mas las Capacitaciones que ahí le brindan, que le ayudan a progresar en su negocio y también en su familia, ahora ella sabe como distribuir sus ganancias,  gracias a sus ahorros ya tiene su casa. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de carne para su negocio.
texts.en: Mariela is a member of the communal bank Solidaridad. She is 25 years old and is the owner of a market stall where she sells meat. She is a mother of one son and has been a member of FINCA Peru for more than two years. She likes to attend the meeting at her communal bank where she learn about being punctual. She likes yet more the training sessions they offer there, as they help her to progress in her business and also in her family. Now she knows how to distribute her profits. Thanks to her savings she now has her own house. She is requesting a loan to invest in buying meat for her business.

loans.use: to buy meat for her business.

loans.name: Janett Marisa

texts.es: Janett es socia del Bancomunal Solidaridad, tiene 29 años de edad, es dueña de una tienda donde vende repuestos para carros, es madre de 1 hijo, y es socia de FINCA Perú hace más de 10 años, aprendió mucho en su Bancomunal como a ahorrar y progresar tanto en su negocio como en su hogar, gracias a los ahorros ella pudo estudiar una carrera profesional y también hizo crecer su negocio. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio como repuestos para carros.
texts.en: Janett is a member of the communal bank Solidaridad. She is 29 years old and is the owner of a shop where she sells spare parts for cars. She is the mother of one son and has been a member of FINCA Peru for more than 10 years. She learnt a lot in her communal bank such as how to save and progress both in her business and in her home. Thanks to her savings she was able to study a professional career and also help her business grow. She is requesting a loan to invest in buying stock for her car parts business.

loans.use: to buy car spare parts for her business.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une jeune dame de 23ans. Elle est revendeuse de friperies (vêtements) depuis 2011. Elle exerce seule cette activité au marché et s’approvisionne à HEDZRANAWOE. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des bals de friperies. Elle veut épargner et réinvestir dans l’activité, agrandir son commerce et avoir d’enfants. Son conjoint est commerçant.
texts.en:
Abla is a young 23-year-old woman. She has been selling second hand clothing since 2011. She works alone at the market and gets her supplies in Hedzranowoe.

Abla is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy bales of second hand clothing. She wants to save money, to reinvest in her business, to expand her business and to have children. Her spouse is a shopkeeper.

loans.use: to buy bales of second hand clothing.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey used his previous loan of 30,000 KES to buy cereals. He made more profits, which he used to expand his business premise.  

He has requested a new loan of 60,000 KES to buy sorghum, maize and beans.

loans.use: To buy sorghum, maize and beans.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Amélé est une femme de35ans. Elle est mariée et a 01 enfant de 07ans qui va à l’école. Pour venir en aide à son mari dans les charges du foyer, elle a décidé par vendre en 1997 les charbons de bois. Elle vend dans un marché de la place et s’approvisionne à Lomé et dans les localités lointaines du pays. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois. Elle veut augmenter son stock, devenir une grande revendeuse de charbon de bois et avoir une maison.
texts.en:
Amélé is a 35-year-old woman. She is married and has a 7-year-old child who goes to school. She decided to start selling charcoal in 1997 in order to support her husband with the household expenses. She sells it at a local market and gets her supplies in Lomé and in some of the country's more remote communities.

Amélé is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to buy bags of charcoal. She wishes to increase her inventory and become a large reseller of charcoal, and to have a house.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Adakou

texts.fr:
Adakou est une femme âgé(e) de 61ans. Elle a 02 enfants  âgés de 42ans et 35ans. Adakou travaille comme revendeuse de charbons de bois, de cartes de recharges et des produits d’alimentation générale. Son approvisionnement se fait à Lomé et elle exerce l’activité à domicile.
Adakou a requis son troisième  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des cartes, de charbon de bois et des produits d’alimentation générale.
Elle veut épargner, agrandir l’activité et prendre soin de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adakou is 61 years old. She has 2 children aged 42 and 35. Adakou works as a retailer of charcoal, recharge card and grocery products. She stocks up in Lomé and sells her merchandise at home.

Adakou has requested her 3rd loan from WAGES in order to buy recharge cards, charcoal and grocery products. She wants to build her savings, expand her business and take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy recharge cards, charcoal and grocery products.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a 39-year-old lady with two children. She sells electronics and has been in the business for three years now. She gets a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

This will be her first loan from KADET Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to increase her stock of electronics. With the profits, she plans to save and buy a plot of land. She hopes to have a prosperous future.

loans.use: to increase the stock of electronics for sale.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 30 years old. He is a married man and a father of one child, age 2 years.  

Wilson has been a livestock trader for a period of four years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

He is taking his third loan of KES 50,000 from KADET Ltd., hoping to purchase two young cows to raise and sell later at higher price.  

The profits that he earns will be used to purchase tea seedlings as he intends to practice tea farming in his farm. He hopes to invest in various developments for his family.

loans.use: To purchase two cows for resale.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 42 years old, married and has three children. 

He runs a tailoring business to earn a living. He has been in the business for 14 years and has employed one person.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to improve his business because he has been trained in business management skills.
 
Leonard hopes to expand his business premise in the future. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the manual labourers.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 39 years old, married and blessed with two children.  She has been operating a salon for 11 years. She has employed one person in her business.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business. This is because she has been trained in business management skills.

Catherine hopes to expand her business and employ more people. She needs a loan of 30,000 KES to buy hair oil, hair braids and nail polish.

loans.use: to buy hair oil, hair braids and nail polish.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 59 years old. She is a widow and lives with her family: her 34-year-old son, who is busy with an agricultural business; her daughter-in-law, who is a housewife, and her 3-year-old grandson. 

The family earns a living by selling canisters of liquid gas. It is widely used in the nearby villages by households, as gas pipes have not been laid. 

In addition, Tamar is busy with a small-scale vineyard business. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 GEL.

Tamar requested a loan for purchasing more liquid gas. Her sales of gas will increase and it will positively influence the income of the family. With the increased income, she will be able to finance her children’s study. Her dream is to repair her house and with this loan, her wishes will be fulfilled.

loans.use: to purchase liquid gas for resale.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old, married, and has three children, age 8, 5 and 2 years. 

He owns tea plantations and has been in this business for a period of three years. The green tea leaves he plucks give him a monthly income of KES 12,000.  

He is now taking his third loan of KES 40,000 from KADET Ltd., and he intends to use this amount to purchase tea seedlings for transplanting since he has expanded his farming land.  

The profits earned will be used for future developments. He hopes to be prosperous in his farming and to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase tea seedlings for transplanting.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 53 years old and married. He has five children, age 29, 24, 20, 17 and 14 years.  

He is a livestock trader and has been in operation for the past 12 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.  

He is taking his fifth loan of KES 60,000 from KADET Ltd., and he wishes to purchase goats and cows that, in turn, he will sell at a higher price. 

The profits earned will be used to repay the loan and to plow back into the business. He hopes to succeed in his business.

loans.use: To purchase cows and goats for sale.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru: Любовь 26 лет,  воспитывает двух детей.   В 2005 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Любовь начала свой бизнес в разведении свиноматок со стартовой суммой в 20,000 сом (KGS). Также, для того, чтобы покрыть ежедневные расходы, Любовь занимает пошивом и реставрацией верхней одежды. Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  ежемесячный доход Любви от бизнес – деятельности составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса в животноводстве, Любовь обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 голов свиноматок.  Доходы от кредита Любовь планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Lubov is 26 years old, she is raising two children. In 2005, while looking for a source of income for her family, Lubov started her own business breeding sows with an initial sum of 20,000 som (KGS). Additionally, in order to cover her daily expenses, Lubov sews and repairs clothing. Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Lubov's monthly income from her businesses amounts to 20,000 som (KGS).

In order to continue developing her livestock business, Lubov has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase 2 additional sows. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rocío  es una mujer que tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil  soltera, sin hijos, vive con sus padres en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados al comercio. Rocío vive en casa propia en el caserío Froilan Alama del distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 150 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Rocío es la  venta de productos de belleza , este pequeño negocio la tiene instalada en su propio domicilio, donde atiende a sus clientes ya Fidelizados; así mismo también realiza labores de cosmetología y cuenta con 2 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en ambos negocios. Sus  padres lo apoyan arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente Rocío se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su establecimiento comercial (pequeño negocio) , esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 1800 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de mercadería (productos de belleza), adquisición de sillas, espejos, maquinas de corte de cabello, secadora,02 mostradores; y así mismo realizar mejoras en su local; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Rocío is a 23-year-old woman.  She is single with no children, and lives with her parents in their own home.  She mentions that the quality of life in her community is subsistence living. The majority of residents work for themselves in agriculture, livestock, handicrafts, and raising small animals, and some of them also work in retail.

Rocío lives in her own home in the village of Froilan Alama in Tambogrande district in the department of Piura; she only has basic electrical service [no running water]. She also mentions that about 150 families live in this village under these conditions.

The commercial activity in which Rocío works is selling beauty products.  She has this small business set up in her own home, where she serves her customers who are already loyal.  She also provides cosmetology services, and has two years of experience which has allowed her to keep her already established customer base in both businesses.  Her parents support her heavily in the work that she does, and there's a good family relationship between them.

Rocío has currently proposed to expand her inventory in regards to her commercial establishment (her small business), owing to the fact that it is a very profitable activity in her neighborhood.  For these reasons she is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the sum of 1,800 new soles, which will be allocated to investing in the purchase of merchandise (beauty products) and the acquisition of chairs, mirrors, hair-dressing machines, a dryer, and two counters.  She will also make improvements to her premises.  In time, this will allow her to improve her standard of living along with her family's.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and purchase cosmetology tools.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 47 years old. She lives in a small village district of Gurjaani with her family: her husband, Akaki, an artisan who makes firewood stoves; two sons, 24 and 22 years old, and a daughter-in law. 

The family earns money through an agriculture business. In particular, she has a vineyard, a milking cow and pigs. Manana sells her products -- milk, cheese, grapes and piglets -- on the local open market. In addition to this, family members are busy making and selling firewood stoves, which they sell seasonally. The average monthly income of the family is 1,100 GEL.

Manana requested a loan for purchasing car. Manana will use it for sales of family products. With the car, she will be able to move comfortably and easily. This will save the costs related to renting a car and the family's monthly income will increase. 

She will spend the biggest portion of her income to develop the agricultural business. Manana will buy one more milking cow and pigs. She will produce more cheese and curds, and her sales from agricultural products will increase.

loans.use: to purchase a car for business purposes.

loans.name: Elphas

texts.en: Elphas is 56 years old, married, and blessed with four children ages 35, 30, 24, and 15 years old. He is a livestock trader in Kabirirsang and has been in operation for a period of over 30 years, earning a monthly income of KES 22,000. He is requesting a loan of KES 40,000 from KADET Ltd. This will be his third loan, having successfully repaid the previous ones. He wishes to purchase five cows that he will resell at a higher price. The earned profits will be used to plough back to his livestock business. He hopes to prosper in his business and improve the welfare of his family.

loans.use: To purchase  livestock for resale.

loans.name: Olayinka

texts.fr:
Olayinka est un homme âgé de 35 ans. Il est marié à une institutrice.
Olayinka travaille comme informaticien et vendeur d’articles informatiques depuis 2009. Il vend dans une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Olayinka a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des matériels informatiques pour la revente. Il veut épargner, agrandir la boutique et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Olayinka is a 35-year old man. He is married to a kindergarten  teacher. Olayinka has been working as a computer technician and vendor of computer articles since 2009. He sells out of a store and stocks up in Lomé.

Olayinka has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy computer supplies for resale. He would like to save money, expand his store and be able to provide for his family’s continued well-being.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo  es un hombre  que tiene  44 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, sin hijos a  su cargo, vive en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Oswaldo  vive en casa propia en el  caserío Somate Alto del distrito de Tambogrande, departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este distrito viven aproximadamente unas 120  familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Oswaldo es al transporte público de mototaxi el recorrido lo realiza entre las zonas de Somate Alto  – Tambogrande y visciversa. Además se dedica a prestar servicio de Internet (con 03 cabinas propias) con atención por las tardes, generándole ingresos diarios para cubrir gastos propios; cabe destacar que en esta actividad  de transporte público Oswaldo cuenta con 05 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. Además Oswaldo también se dedica a la agricultura donde tiene sembrado cultivo de limón.
Actualmente Oswaldo esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 1500 nuevos soles que será para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo y compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is 44 years old, single, without dependent children and lives in his own house. It is mentioned that the quality of life in the community is for subsistence, the majority of inhabitants are self-employed workers who are engaged in the commerce, agriculture and livestock.

Oswaldo lives in his own house, which is located in the small town of Somate Alto in Tambogrande´s district, department of Piura. His house has electricity. It is also mentioned that in the district approximately 120 families live under the similar conditions.

Oswaldo makes a living driving his moto taxi between Zonas de Somate Alto y Tambogrande. Moreover, he provides internet services (owns three internet cubicles), which are open during the afternoons. These generate revenues to cover his own expenses.

It is important to mention that in the transportation field, Oswaldo has five years of experience, which has allowed him to maintain an already established clientele. 

In addition, Oswaldo also makes a living farming. He has a Lemon crop. Currently, Oswaldo is requesting to EDPYME Alternativa a new loan for  1,500 New Soles for the maintenance of his vehicle and for the purchase of fertilizer for his lemon crop because it is a very profitable activity in the area, which in time will allow him to improve his family´s standard of living.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of his motorcycle and to purchase fertilizer for his crop

loans.name: Faig

texts.ru:
Faig 44 qoda. On jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i 2 detmi. Faig yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Agdam kotoriy yavlyayetsya okkupirovannimi territoriyami Karabaxa. Faig uje god kak imeyet svoy taxi. Kak vi videte nad mashinoy imeyetsya specialnoye oborudovaniye iz jeleza, eto dlya perevozki tajolix gruzov. Faig krome transportirovki ludey tak je transportiruyet tajoliye gruzi. 

Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Faig , za pervuyu ssudu on razvil svoy bizness prodaji odejdi, no v posledstvii on reshil izmenit svoy bizness i stat taxistom. Faig onche blagodaren lenderam i Kive za ssudu. Seychas on prosit pomoch yemu v uludshenii yego biznessa , on nujdayetsya v 1000 AZN chtobi on smog kupit nujniye zapchasti dlya togo chtobi pochinit mashinu.
texts.en:
Faig is 44 years old. He lives in the Baku region together with his wife and 2 children. Faig is an internally displaced person from Agdam, which lies within the occupied Karabakh territories. For the past year, Faig has been operating his own taxi service. As you can see in the photo, the car also has a special metal rack on its roof, which allows Faig to transport heavy cargo in addition to passengers.

This is Faig's second Kiva loan. He used his first loan to develop his clothing sales business, but has since decided to change his occupation and became a taxi driver. Faig is very grateful to Kiva and his lenders for his first loan. Presently, he is asking for help in improving his new business - he needs 1000 AZN to buy spare parts and repair his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is 29 years old, married, and is blessed with one child. To earn a living, he does photography. He has been in this business for three years and has employed one person. He is able to provide for his family with the income from his business.

Collins hopes to open a big studio in the future. He needs 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a digital camera.

loans.use: To buy a digital camera.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарина – 25 лет, добросовестная, умная и ответственная девушка. Она не замужем. Занимается торговлей парфюмерной продукции в центральном рынке города. Опыт в этой деятельности около 3 лет. Зарина – старшая дочь в семье. Она помогает своим родителям зарабатывая самостоятельно. Так как начинается свадебный сезон, на полученный кредит хочет увеличить ассортимент парфюмерной продукции. С каждого дохода она откладывает необходимую сумму для себя, на будущую свадьбу. Зарина выражает свою благодарность нашей организации за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Zarina is 25 years old and single. She is a conscientious, smart and responsible young woman. She sells perfumes at the city's central market and has almost 3 years of experience in this area. Zarina is the oldest daughter in her family and helps her parents by earning her own salary. As the wedding season is beginning, she would like to use this loan to expand the assortment of perfumes in her shop. From all her profits, Zarina puts aside a certain sum for her future wedding. She would like to express her gratitude to MDO Arvand, LLC for their support.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes and expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, vice présidente de l’association d’affaire Johovanise, Femme courageuse, infatigable, entrepreneur, âgée de 40 ans, mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est  vendeuse des  poissons au marché central de Virunga. Son mari  est sans emploi, parfois il réalise des petites commissions sur la vente de parcelles dans le quartier aussitôt, qu’il a été associé par ses amis. Elle commença son business avec le fonds propre reçu de son mari. Alors, elle bénéficia le crédit de l’IMF Hekima pour fonds additionnels. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et scolarité pour ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  4eme  cycle de crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires évoluent positivement. Toute fois, Grace aux crédits de Hekima, elle a réalisé des petits équipements pour sa famille (table, renouvellement des chaises, casseroles, etc.). Ainsi, ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  5 paniers de poissons et autres accessoires de ménages. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir confortablement et acheter  une  parcelle de souvenir résultant du crédit Hekima. La cliente remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés et que la photo fut prise a l’intérieur du bureau de marché Central Virunga.
texts.en:
The client is the vice-president of the business association Johovanise. A brave and tireless entrepreneur, she is a 40-year-old mother of eight children who all go to school. She sells fish at the central market of Virunga. Her husband is unemployed, but he occasionally earns a small commission on the sale of land in the area through his friends’ contacts. 

She started her business with capital provided by her husband, which she supplemented with credits obtained from the Hekima MFI. Her profits help to boost her savings, and to pay for food and for her children’s tuition. 

Past loans have allowed her to acquire various household items for her family (a table, new chairs, pots, etc.). With her business showing growth throughout the last cycle, she has applied for her 4th loan. She will use this new loan to purchase five baskets of fish and more household items. 

She wants to see her children grow up comfortably, and hopes someday to buy a plot of land. She wishes to thank the Hekima MFI and its partners for helping low-income women to become self-sufficient.  

It should be noted that some of the group members are carrying their babies in this photo, which was taken inside the offices of the central market of Virunga.

loans.use: to buy five baskets of fish and various household items.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a widowed lady. She is 56 years old and supporting her two children aged 25 and 18 years old. She owns a retail shop, and has been in operation for the past three years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.  

She is requesting her third loan of KES 60,000 from KADET Ltd. and intends to use this amount to purchase additional stock of sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, cooking fat and oil, washing detergents, and soaps for her shop. 

The profits she earns will be put back to into her business and used to educate her children. Her dream is to see her children excel in education for the better life.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, cooking fat and oil, washing detergents, and soaps for her shop.

loans.name: Sheria Group

texts.fr: La cliente est entrepreneur, leader de l'association d’affaire Sheria, âgée de 46 ans, veuve, mère de 7 enfants. Son  mari fut décédé suite à une mort inopinée. La  cliente fait  le petit commerce de maïs. Elle installe ses marchandises dans le quartier périphérique de Kiziba II. Il ya environs 16 ans qu’elle exerce ces petites activités.  En plus, elle vend également des boissons (Primus, Fanta, coca, etc.) à son domicile pour accumuler plus des revenus.  En 2005, elle bénéficia de premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima de 50$ pour  renforcer  son capital. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  10 sacs de maïs et les brassicoles (10 casiers de Primus, 7 casiers de boissons Aigle, 8 casiers de Fanta ). Elle ambitionne pérenniser  son entreprise et construire confortablement  sa maison. La cliente remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes pour une émancipation économique et financière.
texts.en:
The client is the leader of the business association Sheria. She is a 46-year-old entrepreneur, widowed and the mother of 7 children. Her husband died unexpectedly. She sells corn and exhibits her wares in an outlying district of Kiziba II. She has been doing this for about 16 years. She also sells drinks (Primus, Fanta, Coke, etc.) from her home to increase her income.

Luanda received her first loan of $50 from Hekima in 2005, so that she could strengthen her capital. This new loan will be used to buy 10 bags of corn and drinks (10 cases of Primus, 7 cases of Aigle drinks, 8 cases of Fanta). Luanda's aim is to make her business sustainable and to build her house comfortably.

The customer thanks Hekima for its actions to empower women with lower incomes so that they can experience economical and financial emancipation.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of corn and drinks (10 cases of Primus, 7 cases of Aigle drinks and 8 cases of Fanta).

loans.name: Daysi Marlene

texts.es: Daysi Marlene es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de comida en el lugar de su residencia, ella prepara todo tipo de platillos para el desayuno y el almuerzo huevos, fríjoles, sopas, pollo, arroz, entre otros es muy conocida en la zona, pues a pesar de que es el lugar para comer más higiénico, tiene la comida más exquisita, gracias a la experiencia y el don en la cocina que posee Daysi, además todo lo elabora con producto de primera calidad y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles; Es una mujer emprendedora, servicial que ama su trabajo, piensa que siempre hay que apuntar más alto de lo que sabes que puedes lograr, para así llegar al éxito, con ese pensamiento positivo es que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar carnes, granos básicos, embutidos, verduras, bebidas, etc. Daysi Marlene tiene la confianza que así podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Daysi Marlene is a hardworking woman that works in food sales in her residence.  She prepares every type of small dish for breakfast and lunch - eggs, beans, soups, chicken, rice among others. She is well known in the region, since in spite of that it is the cleanest place to eat, it has the most delicious food, thanks to Daysi's experience and gift in the kitchen.  Furthermore, she produces everything with high quality products and sells it at really affordable prices.  She is a helpful, enterprising woman that loves her work. She thinks that you always have to aim higher than you think you can achieve to arrive at success. With this positive thought she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL that will permit her to buy meat, basic grains, sausages, vegetables, drinks, etc. Daysi Marlene is confident that in this way she can bring her home economic security.

loans.use: to buy meats, basic grains, sausages, vegetables and drinks.

loans.name: Shagali Group

texts.fr: La cliente, présidente du groupe de crédit  Shagali, Femme courageuse, entrepreneur,  âgée de 38 ans, mère de 6 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est  vendeuse des  petits articles devant son domicile notamment (Riz, sucres, Fanta, savons, sels, épisses, etc.) Son mari travaille dans une agence de transport. Elle commença son business avec le crédit de Hekima, de lors qu’elle fut informée par ses voisins des activités de cette IMF dans la ville de Goma. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et scolarité pour ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  5eme  cycle de crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires régressent suite à la crise et  aux problèmes de l’insécurité de la région. Toute fois, Grace aux crédits de Hekima, elle a réalisé des équipements ménagers importants pour sa famille. Ainsi, ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  2 sacs de aies, 2 bidons d’huile de Rina, et autres divers. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir en douceur. La cliente remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
The client is the president of the lending group Shagali. She is 38 years old, a brave woman, an entrepreneur and the mother of 6 children who all go to school. She sells small items in front of her home, most notably rice, sugar, Fanta, soaps, salt and spices. Her husband works for a transportation agency.

She started her business with a loan from Hekima, once she found out about the institution's activities in Goma from neighbours. The profits from her business are used to build savings and pay for her children's food and education. 

She has just received her 5th loan. Over time, this customer has seen her business decrease in the wake of the economic crisis and because of the region's security problems. However, thanks to Hekima's loans, she has been able to buy a significant amount of household equipment for her family. This new credit will be used to buy 2 bags of garlic, 2 cans of Rina oil and other products. She would like to see her children grow up without trouble.

The customer thanks Hekima for its actions to empower women with lower incomes.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of garlic, 2 cans of Rina oil and other products.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en zona rural, él se dedica a la agricultura y ya tiene varios años de experiencia en este ámbito, cultiva maíz y frijol, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente pues sus cosechas siempre son muy abundantes y puede comerciar más, además que todo es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios realmente bajos en relación a la mayoria, ya que es una persona muy consiente en cuanto a precios, Juan es muy servicial siempre atiende a sus clientes con una sonrisa en el rostro; es un hombre decidido y muy trabajador, con muchas metas que quiere alcanzar y está aprovechando todas las oportunidades que se le presentan, piensa que la constancia y la astucia serán sus mayores secretos para alcanzar ese triunfo que desea, es así como le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, semillas de maíz y frijol, abono, control de plagas y algunas herramientas para preparar la tierra. Juan Carlos tiene fe que así lograra darle una vida plena a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos lives with his life partner and their children in a rural region. He works in agriculture and now has several years of experience in this field.  He cultivates corn and beans. He has gained many clients recently since his harvests are always very abundant and he is able to do more business. Furthermore, it is of high quality and he sells it at really low prices in relation to the majority since he is a very consistent person in terms of prices. 

Juan is very helpful. He always attends to his clients with a smile on his face.  He is a hard-working, determined man with many goals that he wishes to achieve.  He is taking advantage of all of the opportunities that are presented to him.  He thinks that perseverance and astuteness will be his greatest secrets to achieve the triumph that he desires. For this, he requests a loan from INTEGRAL that allows him to buy seeds for corn and beans, fertilizer, pest control and some tools to prepare the earth. Juan Carlos has faith that in this way he will succeed in giving a full life to his family.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, fertilizer, pest control and tools for preparing the earth

loans.name: Jose Ignacio

texts.es: El señor José es originario de Managua actualmente tiene 15 años de vivir en Granada, casado, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa  actividad que inicio al casarse para formar un hogar, decidió independizarse con su esposa  y buscar la manera de generar ingresos para mantener el hogar  a la edad de 27 años,  este ha sido su primer negocio  donde recibe el apoyo de su esposa, sus productos los comercializa en el mercado donde se siente satisfecho porque cuenta con buena clientela. Solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería tales como ropa   de niño y de adultos, este crédito le ayudara a generar mejores ingresos, sus planes futuros son llegar  a tener un tramo cerrado  en el que pueda guardar su mercadería  y no tener que trasladarla a su casa a diario. Su meta próxima  es seguir trabajando duro para poder cumplir
texts.en: Jose comes from Managua, but he has been living in Granada for the past 15 years. He is 27 years old, he is married and he is a retailer selling clothes. He has started his activity after his marriage: in order to form a family, together with his wife he decided to become independent and to look for a way to earn money to provide for his family. This is his first activity and his wife supports him; he sells his products in the market and he is very satisfied with it because he has good customers. He is requesting a loan to buy products such as children’s clothes and adult’s clothes. This loan will help him improve his earnings, and in the future he plans on owing a locked stall where to store his products, in order not to transport them from his house every day. His next goal is to keep on working hard to be able to carry his activity out.

loans.use: To buy children and adult's clothes.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine, a 28-year-old married mother of two children aged nine and two years, owns a retail shop where she earns her living. In operation for the past 12 years, the business earns her a monthly income of KES. 16,000.

Now requesting a loan of KES. 50,000 from KADET LTD to purchase sugar, rice, washing and bathing soaps, tea leaves, cooking oil and fat for resale, Irine will use the anticipated profits both to repay the loan and for family upkeep. Ultimately, she hopes to have a happy and financially stable family.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, washing and bathing soaps, tea leaves, cooking oil and fat for resale.

loans.name: Oira

texts.en: Oira used his previous loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy bread for wholesale distribution, resulting in increased business profits and improvement to his farming business.  Oira, who hopes to grow his clientele in the future, is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy more loaves of bread.

loans.use: to buy loaves of bread for wholesale distribution.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to protect her house from heavy rains, by raising it and installing a new roof.

loans.name: Bukhuto

texts.en:
Bukhuto is 51 years old, married, and has one child. His daughter-in-law also lives with him in a small village of Borjomi District, South Georgia. Bukhuto’s wife is a manager of the village entertainment club and earns 110 Laris per month. His daughter-in-law is a teacher in local school.

Bukhuto and his son run an agricultural business. They have a milk cow and they produce cheese, which they sell in the village. Bukhuto and his son also grow potatoes and carrots on the family-owned plot of the land. They sell harvested products locally to greengrocery retailers. The average monthly income of the family is 550 Laris.

Bukhuto is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers. He will till the land, fertilize it, and sow potatoes.  They hope that the weather conditions are favorable and the family gets a plentiful harvest, which will be sold for a good price. The family will get planned income and use it for financing their needs during the year.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 44 years old, married and blessed with two children aged five and 10. She runs a grocery to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years. She has improved her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Paulina has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy peas, maize, vegetables and bananas.

loans.use: To buy peas, maize, vegetables and bananas.

loans.name: Tengiz

texts.en:
Tengiz is a 44-year-old farmer from a village in the Gardabani District. He lives with his family: his wife, Elmira; his mother (a pensioner); and an aunt (a pensioner). The family earns a living through their agricultural business. They have a milk cow and two calves. Elmira produces cheese and sells it in the village. Tengiz has a truck and he provides transportation services to the population of his and nearby villages. The family's total average monthly income is 1,000 Laris.

Tengiz has requested credit to purchase another milk cow. With two milk cows, Elmira will be able to double production and sales of cheese. The income of the family will increase. The family members will be able to purchase additional household goods to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Tuamoyo Group

texts.en:
Salma, who is in her early 40s, is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She has earned a living by running a fruit and vegetable business for the last four years. She works from 9.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

She is requesting her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to pay school fees, buy more fruit to sell and pay household expenses, and paid back all of her loans successfully. She will use this latest loan to buy more fruit to sell and pay her children's school fees. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Tuamoyo," which has a total of 13 members, all of whom will hold the others accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell and pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Saranga Group

texts.en:
Jamila, who is in her late 20s, is married and has three children, all of whom are still in school. She has earned a living by running a fruit and vegetable stand for the last three years. She works from 7.00 am to 4.00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

She is requesting her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to buy more items to sell and to start building her two-room house. She has successfully repaid all of her loans. She will use this latest loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell and to continue building her house.  Her dream is to one day be able to add a third room to her house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Saranga," which has a total of 15 members, all of whom hold the others accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell and to continue building her house.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en: Florencio is from Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 60 years old. Florencio is married and has three children. To make a living, he owns and operates a tricycle transport service. He has been in his business for three years and earns PHP 8,000 a month from these activities. In 2010, Florencio joined GDMPC. Florencio is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000, which will be used to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 41 years old, married and has three children who range in age from 10 to 18 years old. All of her children are in school and still live at home. For the last 15 years, she has earned a living by selling used clothes. Sarah is doing well in this business, which she learned from her sister, and is planning to build a house. She is requesting this loan to buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata is 23 years old. She lives in Airport, is single, and has a four-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. For the past two years, she has been selling door locks, nails, and other items. She is requesting a loan to purchase door locks, nails, and other items for her business. She likes her business because it helps her to feed her child. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase door locks, nails, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 55 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in Maquilao, Tangub City, Philippines.  Anecita operates a seafood selling business, which she has been doing for 20 years.  Her products include crabs and shrimp. She earns 4,000 PHP a month from her business. 

Anecita is requesting a loan for 6,900 PHP, which she will use for crab fattening and to buy more shrimp. Anecita has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, she wants to build a house and have her children complete their studies.

loans.use: for crab fattening and to buy more shrimp.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy lives in Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 29 years old and a single mom who earns a living by buying and selling fish and shrimp. She has been in this business for the last five years and earns about PHP 10,000 a month from her work. Daisy joined GDMPC in 2009, and is applying for a loan for PHP 14,400 to expand her business by buying more fish and shrimp to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying more fish and shrimp to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 49 years old, widowed, and has four children.  She is from Macupa, Tangub City. As their source of revenue, Elsa plants and harvests bananas, which she has been doing for 15 years.  She earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Elsa joined GDMPC. Elsa is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will be use to purchase fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is from Barangay 5, Tangub City. She is 33 years old, married and the mother of four children. For the last eight years, she has earned a living by providing transportation services. She earns about PHP 2,500 a month. Vilma joined GDMPC in 2010, and is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to repair the vehicle she uses in her business. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle she uses to provide transportation services.

loans.name: Jennyvie

texts.en:
Jennyvie is 32 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in Maquilao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.  She earns  a living through fish selling, which she has been doing for 10 years.  She helps her husband who does the fishing. She earns 11,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jennyvie joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan for 17,200 PHP, which she will use to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Ma.luisa

texts.en:
Ma.Luisa  is 46 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the Philippines. Ma.Luisa has a shop that sells seafood, which she has run for three years.
