Ma.Luisa is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fish to sell including sardines, milk fish, and flying fish.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Ma.Luisa  hopes to improve her business so she can educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ainukul

texts.ru:
Айнукул 54 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Айнукул на протяжении 25 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 1,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Айнукул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  7 дойных коров, 7 овец, продажа молока и молочных продуктов составляет 20,000 сом в месяц.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнукул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров, что позволит ей увеличить надои.  Доходы от кредита Айнукул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Ainukul is 54 years old. She is married with two children. For 25 years, Ainukul has been raising livestock, having launched this business with the starting capital of 1,000 KGS. Thanks to Ainukul’s hard work, her livestock now includes seven dairy cows and seven sheep; sales of milk and dairy products bring in around 20,000 KGS per month.

In order to continue developing her business, Ainukul turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan of 100,000 KGS for the purchase of dairy cows, which will allow her to increase the volume of milk. Ainukul plans to use the revenues raised thanks to this loan toward further expansion of her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Marìa Elsa

texts.es:
María es una mujer que tiene 64 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con tres  hijos independientes, vive con sus hijos en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados al comercio. María  vive en casa propia en el  distrito de Cayalti del  departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica María  es la  venta de periódicos, este pequeño negocio la tiene instalada en un kiosco alquilado por la municipalidad, donde atiende a sus clientes ya Fidelizados; y cuenta con 10 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida 
Actualmente María se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su establecimiento comercial (pequeño negocio) , esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 1000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de mercadería (periódicos, revistas), y arreglo de su casa; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
María is a woman who is 64 years old, married, with three independent children; she lives with her children in her own house.  It’s mentioned that the quality of life of the community is at the subsistence level. Most of the residents are independent workers in farming, animal husbandry, crafts and raising small animals; some of them also work in commerce.  María lives in her own house in Cayalti District in Lambayeque Department and it has all basic utilities.

The commercial activity María does is selling newspapers.  She has this small business installed in a kiosk she rents from the city; she has regular customers she tends to there and she has ten years’ experience which has allowed her to retain her already established clientele.

At present, María has decided to expand her inventory with respect to her small business because it’s quite profitable in the zone and because of this has requested a new, 1000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy merchandise (newspapers and magazines) and to do some home improvements which in time will allow her to improve her standard of living with her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business and to make home improvements.

loans.name: Edita Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Edita inicia su segundo préstamo  Kiva el primero le ayudo de gran manera ya que le permitió incrementar sus ventas y ingresos, el cual utilizo para la compra de mercadería como telas y accesorios de costura, el segundo préstamo de igual manera lo piensa invertir en la compra de tela y accesorios para elaboración de ropa de bebe, en su negocio no recibe apoyo de nadie. Ella considera que este segundo préstamo le ayudara en gran manera ya que le permitirá incrementar su producción y poder aumentar sus ventas que a la vez le generaran ingresos, su siguiente paso seria seguir trabajando con el apoyo de Kiva y nuestra Institución para poder salir adelante.
texts.en: Edita is starting her second Kiva loan; the first one helped her quite a bit because it allowed her to increase her sales and income.  She used it to buy merchandise like fabric and sewing accessories.  Similarly, she will use her second loan to buy fabric and accessories to make infant clothing.  She has no help from anyone in her business.  She believes that this second loan will be of great help to her because it will make it possible for her to increase production and be able to increase sales that will in turn generate income.  Her next step will be to continue to work with support from Kiva and our institution to be able to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fabric and accessories.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is married with 4 children. She is 53 years old and lives in Namnama, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.
Estrella owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month she earns 8000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more inventory for her general store.
Estrella is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Estrella hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell/retail

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto es un hombre muy trabajador, vive al lado de su pareja con la cual tiene 2 maravillosos hijos de 1 y 8 años de edad, por los cuales da la vida y trabaja muy duro por salir adelante, su pareja lo apoya mucho en todo lo que él1 hace, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica,la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor y sobre todo porque allí se desarrolla la agricultura así como también se encuentra la laguna de Huacachina la cual es visitada por muchos turistas en todo el año. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear y sobre todo aprovecha la oportunidad de comer su platillo favorito el cual es el riquísimo “picante de pallares”.

Día a día Carlos se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante y sobre todo poder darle lo necesario a sus hijos, es así que él trabaja muy duro en su negocio como chofer de taxi, le dedica alrededor de 12 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y sobre todo respetuoso con los clientes.

Carlos está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar la conversión del sistema a gasolina por uno a Gas natural; con esta mejora el podrá gastar menos combustible con lo cual tendrá mayores ingresos para así poder seguir trabajando cada día para seguir adelante y realizar su más grande sueño:” Temer una flota de autos y tener su empresa de taxis”.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto is a very hardworking man. He lives with his partner and together they have two wonderful children, who are one and eight years old. He gives his life for them and works very hard to get ahead. His partner supports him a lot in everything he does. Their home is located in the city of Ica, which is known for its warm and comfortable climate, and most of all, for being an important agricultural area. It is also home to the Huacachina lagoon, which is visited by many tourists all year round. When he has some free time he enjoys going out for walks, and above all, he takes the opportunity to eat his his favorite dish, which is the delicious "picante de pallares."

Every day Carlos makes his best effort to get ahead, and most of all, to give his children what they need, so he works very hard in his business as a taxi driver. He devotes around 12 hours a day to work and may serve up to 30 passengers in a day. He believes business is going well for him because he is very friendly, and above all respectful, to his passengers. 

Carlos is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they have offered he will be able to make the conversion from a gasoline system to natural gas. This improvement will allow him to use less fuel, which will increase his income, so that he may continue working every day to move forward and achieve his greatest dream: to have a car fleet and have his own taxi company.

loans.use: to convert his gasoline-fueled vehicle to NGV (Natural Gas Vehicle).

loans.name: Incris Elena

texts.es:
La señora Incris, vive en la Zona Sur de Costa Rica, en la provincia de Puntarenas, cantón de Golfito, distrito de Guaycara, zona caracterizada por ofrecer pocas de oportunidades de empleo remunerado, de allí que a estas mujeres no les queda otra opción que establecer su fuente de autoempleo, en este caso la señora Incris, toma la decisión de comenzar una actividad de comercio minorista, ofreciendole a sus clientes la posibilidad de darles crédito a sesenta dias;comienza hace cuatro años con crédito de los proveedores, sin embargo de un momento a otro el principal proveedor, cierra el crédito, y esto hace que comienze a valorar solicitar un préstamo para reforzar su capital de trabajo, y poder continuar con la actividad comercial, que se ha constituido en un aporte a la económía domestica, ya que todavía tiene un niño pequeño, que imposibilita que salga a trabajar fuera de la casa; pues de hacerlo lo que ganaría con un trabajo remunerado tendria que destinarlo como pago de salario, para una persona que atienda a su hijo de tres años.
Dentro de los planes a futuros, esta el poder hacer mejoras en su vivienda, ya que donde habita es una casa de interes social, las que de adjudican con lo básico, con la idea que sean los propios adjudicatarios quienes realizen mejoras a la vivienda, logrando de esta forma mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Incris lives in the Southern zone of Costa Rica in the province of Puntarenas, in the region of the Gulf and district of Guaycara, a zone characterized by offering few opportunities for paid employment.  For that reason for these women there are no other options than to find a means of self-employment.  In this case, Mrs. Incris made the decision to begin a small commercial activity offering her clients the possibility of giving them a 60 day credit.  She began four years ago with credit from her providers.  However, from one moment to the next the principal provider closed her credit, and for that reason she is asking for a loan in order to reinforce the capital for her work and to be able to continue with her commercial activity.  Her work has helped with her domestic economic situation, since she still has a young child, which makes it impossible for her to work outside of the home since then she would have to use what she earned to pay for childcare for her three year old.  Among her future plans is the goal of making improvements on her home, since where she lives is a public housing unit, and thus comes only with the basics with the idea that the inhabitants will make improvements to the home.  In this way she hopes to improve the life of her family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise from catalogues, clothing, purses and intimate apparel for women, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish building and plastering the walls.

loans.name: Ngot

texts.en:
Ngot is 30 years old.  She is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.  She has been selling post cards and books for more than 10 years, earning approximately $3 per day.  Her husband is a painter who earns about $15 per day.   

In order to improve her family’s finances, Ngot is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase piglets to breed and sell when they gain weight.  By doing so, she would earn additional income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her pig farm and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed in order to resale when they gain weight

loans.name: Monserrate Elena

texts.es:
EL Banco Divino Niño Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Monserrate, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, 2 mayores de edad y los menores de 12, 10 y 8  años de edad, todos sus hijos estudian los mayores en universidad y los menores en  colegio y  escuela, todos sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella con la intención de ayudar a su esposo realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y zapatos, nos  cuenta nuestra amiga que él se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Quito a vender sus productos y se queda quince días vendiendo en esta ciudad, luego regresa y se vuelve a ir después de una semana, compra la mercadería de Guayaquil y también en Quito, vende al contado y también deja a crédito  a sus clientes más conocidos. Nos cuenta nuestra amiga que lleva más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que siempre le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y zapatos de todo tipo. Lleva más de 10 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos muchas veces su marido ha podido financiar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un almacén para que su esposo se quede cerca de la familia.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Divino Niño Jesús" (Divine Christ Child) meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa, which is known by its nickname "The Sultana of Coffee" because of its extensive coffee crop that has an incomparable flavor. This area is also known for its food and the warmth of its people.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Monserrate. She is 45 years old, married, and has five children. Two of them are grown and the younger children are ages 12, 10, and 8. All of them are students. The two oldest children are at a university and the rest are in school. All of her children still live with her. Her husband is a merchant.

Monserrate intends to help her husband, so she will utilize this loan for his business. He sells clothing of all types, as well as shoes. Monserrate says that her husband travels to the city of Quito and stays there 15 days to sell his products before returning home. He then has to buy his merchandise in Guayaquil, although some of it is purchased in Quito. He sells his products for cash, but he also extends credit to his more established customers. Monserrate says that her husband has been in business for more than 20 years and has always done very well.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and shoes of all types. Monserrate has been with her Communal Bank for more than 10 years and enjoys being a member because the loans have helped to finance her husband's business on many occasions. Her dream is to open a store for her husband so that he can be closer to his family.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and shoes.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 32 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo. Él tiene más de 8 años de trabajar en la agricultura y empezó trabajando con su papá desde los 9 años de edad. 

Para comprar los insumos para sus cultivos tiene que viajar a una ciudad del oriente del país en autobús que tarda cuarenta y cinco minutos en llegar. El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar insumos agrícolas y harinilla para sus gallinas, ya que tiene una granja. 

Con el financiamiento trabajara lo más pronto en la tierra y también para pagar mano de obra. Él tendrá la oportunidad de cultivar y su esposa dispondrá del maíz para elaborar más tortillas, ya que esa es la actividad que ella realiza. 

Él piensa construir su casa de bloque, ya que en la que vive es de madera y ver a su hijo con una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Juan, 32, has a spouse and a son.  He’s been working in farming for more than 8 years; he started helping his father when he was 9 years old.

In order to buy farm supplies he needs to take a forty-five minute bus trip to a city in the east of the country.  The loan he’s asking for is to buy farm supplies and chicken feed since he has a farm.

With the loan he will work the land more quickly and will also be able to pay labor costs.  He will have the opportunity to plant and his wife will have corn to make more tortillas since that’s the activity she carries out.

He plans to build his house with concrete blocks since his current one is wood; he also wants to see his son with a university career.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia, tiene 36 años y está casada con Luis. Viven en armonía familiar, junto a sus hijos, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Chilca.  

Ella es una persona muy emprendedora, desde hace muchos años se gana el sustento económico con la venta de comida. Hasta el momento esta actividad le ha favorecido bastante porque  puede dedicarse a este negocio por las mañanas y por las tardes ayudar a sus hijos en sus tareas escolares. La acogida que tiene Celia en su negocio la anima a continuar y a planear proyectos para el futuro, uno de ellos es establecerse en un local  y abrir un restaurante y por ahora está en este proceso. Es por ello que solicita un préstamo, el cual invertirá en la compra de ollas y utensilios para su negocio. Con las ganancias que obtenga podrá cubrir los costos de educación de sus dos hijos que empezarán el año escolar.

Este es el octavo crédito que tiene con MFP y se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.

Celia invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus exquisitos platos de comida.
texts.en:
Celia, 36, is married to Luis; they live in family harmony with their children in their own house located in Chilca.  She is a very enterprising person.  She’s earned economic support for many years selling food.  To date, the activity has been very beneficial because she can do it in the morning and help her children with their school work in the afternoon.  The welcome Celia’s work has motivates her to continue and to make future plans.  One of them is to open a restaurant and she’s currently in the process of doing so.

This is why she’s asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of pots and utensils for her business. With profits obtained she will cover her two children’s schooling costs; they are about to start the school term.

This is the 8th MFP loan she’s gotten and she feels grateful for the support she receives.  In addition, she promises to be punctual with her installment payments.  Celia will use the requested money to buy ingredients to prepare her delicious food dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Tolerante Group

texts.es:
Tolerante es un grupo solidario de credituyo que se encuentra en su octavo ciclo de credito. El grupo lleva su nombre porque son personas con mucha paciencia y que siempre estan dispuestas a ayudar a sus compañeras en caso de que lo necesiten.

Estela es una de las integrantes del grupo, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos. Estele vende edredones en su casa con sus vecinas desde hace varios años y comenzo porque es fanatica de los edredones y queria comenzar un negocio. Con su credito, Estela quiere comprar suficiente mercancia para generar altas ventas. A futuro, Estela quiere poner un local en el centro de la ciudad e importar mercancia de otros paises.
texts.en:
“Tolerante” is a Credituyo solidarity group in its 8th credit cycle.  The group is so called because they are very patient people who are always ready to help each other in case of need.

Estela is one of the members of the group.  She’s married and has two children.  Estela sells comforters to her neighbors at home.  She started this several years ago because she’s fanatic about comforters and wanted to start a business.  

Estela will use her loan to buy enough merchandise to generate high sales.  In the future, Estela wants to open a store downtown and import merchandise from other countries.

loans.use: to buy comforters to sell.

loans.name: Freddy Alex

texts.es:
Freddy es un joven de 28 años de edad, el cual es muy trabajador y entusiasta, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor y sobre todo porque allí se desarrolla la agricultura así como también se encuentra la laguna de Huacachina la cual es visitada por muchos turistas en todo el año,  cuando dispone de un tiempo libre a Freddy le gusta mucho cantar, sobre todo para distraerse y también le gusta disfrutar de uno de sus platos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”.

Día a día Freddy sale a trabajar muy temprano  en su negocio como chofer de mototaxi, el se dedica alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes.

Freddy está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá darle mantenimiento a su vehículo, así como también comprar un auto radio, con esta mejora  el podrá tener un vehículo en buen estado y podra brindarle comodidad  a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y asi seguir adelante para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su moto propia ya que la que conduce actualmente es alquilada”.
texts.en:
Freddy, 28, is a very hardworking, enthusiastic young man.  His house is located in the city of Ica which is noted for having hot climate and for being very welcoming and especially because agriculture develops there; also the Huacachina Lagoon which attracts many tourists year-round is there.  When Freddy has free time he likes to sing very much to entertain himself and he also likes to enjoy one of his favorite dishes, the very delicious “Ají de Gallina.”

Day to day Freddy heads out to work very early; he works as a mototaxi driver.  He spends about 10 hours daily at work and can tend to up to 30 customers per day.  He believes that he does well in his business because he’s very kind to customers.

Freddy is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to service his vehicle as well as buy a car radio.  
With this improvement he will be able to have a vehicle in good operating conditions and offer better comfort to his customers which will make it possible for him to improve his income to continue toward his greatest dream: to own his motor vehicle because the one he drives now is leased.

loans.use: to buy a car radio and speakers and to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao, aged 53, is a mother of five and lives in the Mognkul Borey district. One of her children is still relying on the family. 

Over the past three years, Mao went to Thailand to work as a construction worker and later on she came back home to cultivate her four-hectare rice field to raise money. She also raises pigs to generate additional income for the family. 

Mao has been with VisionFund since 2009. Having repaid all her previous three loans, Mao applied for her fourth loan from VisionFund, aiming to get the money to cultivate the rice paddy, buy fertilizers, and buy feed for her pigs. With this money, she hopes to increase her crop yield and ensure the health of her pigs so that she can sell them for a good price. Mao now leads a loan group of three female members.

loans.use: to cultivate her rice field, buy fertilizers, and buy feed for her pigs.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. 

Letecia has a shop that sells snacks or native delicacies. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients like sugar, margarine, cheese, condensed milk, flour, cassava chips, banana chips, and rice for making snacks or native delicacies.

Letecia has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks such as cassava cake, banana cake, hot cake, and rice cake.

loans.name: Gigi

texts.en:
Gigi is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Gigi has a shop that sells sea foods like fish and seaweed. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of fish to sell like sardines, dalagang bukid, milkfish, and flying fish.

Gigi has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of seafoods to sell.

loans.name: Faig

texts.ru:
Faig jenat i imeyet 2 detey. On jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. Faig 46 let. 
Uje 11 let kak on imeyet svoyu mashinu dlya transpartirovki gruzov. V osnovnom on zanimayetsya transportirovkoy stroitelnix materialov, i mebeley. Faig seychas nujdayetsya v 1600 AZN chtobi pochinit svoyu mashinu dlya togo chtobi snova nachat rabotu, tak kak yego mashina ne rabotayet on ne mojet transportirovat gruzi. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca kotoriy toje zanimalsya transpartirovkoy gruzov.
texts.en: Faig is married and has 2 children. He is 46 and lives in the Baku region together with his loving family. For the past 11 years, Faig has been using his vehicle to transport cargo. Mainly, he delivers building materials and furniture. Presently, he needs 1600 AZN to repair his vehicle and resume work, as the truck is currently broken and Faig is unable to make deliveries. Faig has learned this business from his father, who also transported cargo for a living.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Dolores Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Dolores una mujer emprendedora continua laborando para una empresa privada ocupando el cargo de Asistente Administrativo, madre de tres hijos. A pesar de sus problemas de salud ella manifiesta ser una mujer con metas a futuro junto con su esposo han podido avanzar en metas que se han propuesto e ir mejorando su vivienda.Uno de sus proyectos para en este año 2012 es levantar un poco mas el nivel de las paredes y tambien remodelar un poco lo que es el area de su cocina por lo que comprara bloques, cemento, hierro, alambre de amarre, arena, piedrin, arena entre otros materiales. Logrando con esta nueva infraestructura poderles brindar a su familia mejores niveles de vida. Agradece a la institucion por su incondicional apoyo.
texts.en:
Dolores is an enterprising woman who continues working at a private firm as an Administrative Assistant.  She’s the mother of three children.  Despite her health problems she states that she’s a woman who has future goals.  With her husband she’s been able to make progress towards the goals they’ve set up for themselves and have been making home improvements.

One of her projects for the year 2012 is to raise the level of the walls a bit more and also to remodel the kitchen area a little and to do so has to buy concrete blocks, cement, iron, tie wire, sand and gravel, among other supplies.  

Attaining this new infrastructure will permit them to give their family a better standard of living.  She thanks the institution for its unconditional support.

loans.use: to raise the walls and remodel the kitchen.

loans.name: Kandice

texts.en:
Kandice is a motivated and dedicated member of her Detroit community where she has lived her entire life. In 2010, she decided to give back to her community by developing a service center where members of inner city Detroit communities could come to get consultation on document preparation, such as: tax preparation, law representation, resume and cover letter writing, and business plan development. In addition to this, her business is also equipped with notary services. 

Currently, the business is home-based and employs one other employee in addition to Kandice, however she also relies on her vast network of family and friends to consult with clients that may need help in fields not in Kandice's expertise. Next year Kandice will be attending law school in hopes of gaining additional experience that will allow her to grow her business. She hopes to continue to grow her business and continue to provide consulting services to her community. She would like to use this loan to build her home office and turn her business into an accredited company.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop, printer/fax machine, business cards, and other business materials

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is engaged in a family agricultural business in a small village in Akhalkalaki District, South Georgia. She lives with her family: her 30-year-old son, her 26-year-old daughter-in-law, and her two-year-old granddaughter. All three adult family members are involved in the family farming business.

They have a milk cow, and Natalia produces cheese from the milk and sells it in the village to local dairy product retailers. They also grow potatoes, barley, and wheat on their family-owned, four-hectare plot of land. They sell the harvested products to local retailers as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris.

Natalia has requested credit for purchasing piglets. She will raise these for seven months and sell the grown pigs in early winter for a profit. From this, Natalia will get additional income for the family. She will use her profits to purchase essential household goods and to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase piglets.

loans.name: Sahir

texts.en:
Sahir is a 35-year-old mother of two from Nazereth. For years she worked for minimum wage as a cashier. All the while, she took cosmetics and stylist courses through Wizo. She then used her skills to create a business: Sahir opened a hair and cosmetics salon. She has gained a loyal and ever growing customer base and now Sahir wants to expand the services she offers.

She needs the loan for an additional hair and styling station, to purchase a washing station sink and chair; coloring, shampoo and conditioning supplies; cosmetics and a solar heating unit.

In the future Sahir wants to hire additional staff and gain further expertise in specialty styles. She wants to develop her salon into a full spa with a range of beauty  treatments.

loans.use: to purchase a hair washing sink and chair; coloring, shampoo and conditioning supplies; cosmetics and a solar heating unit.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma, 49 years old, a widow and mother of four children, has made a living through fish selling to support their daily needs. For over five years in Maquilao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, she has run this type of business. She earns 4,000 a month for these activities. In 2009, Elma joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 9,800 to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to build a new home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Abduvoit

texts.ru: Абдувоит мужчина в возрасте 61 года,женат и имеет двоих детей,проживает в районе Спитамен.Дома он национальную обувь шьет  и продает на вещевом рынке.Это профессия осталось ему от его предков и он старается продолжить а также  научить детей. Он очень ответственный и пунктуальный.С 2005 года кредитуется в организации "Арванд" и ни разу не нарушал условия кредитования и доказал свою добросовестность.На полученные займы он закупил машинку для шитья национальной обуви, а также расширил свой бизнес.В районе его почти все знают и у него много постоянных клиентов.Он просит 1000 сомони для покупки материалов и надеется на вашу помощь.
texts.en: Abduvoit is a 61-year-old man who is married and has two children. He lives in the Spitamen region. Abduvoit makes traditional footwear at home and sells it at the local market. He inherited this craft from his ancestors and tries to carry on the tradition and also teach it to children. Abduvoit is very responsible and punctual. He has been taking loans from MDO Arvand, LLC since 2005 and has never broken the conditions of his loans, proving his integrity. Using his previous loans, he has purchased a sewing machine for making the shoes and expanded his business. He is widely knows in the area and has many steady customers. Abduvoit is requesting 1000 somoni to buy sewing supplies and hopes for your help.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Aladin

texts.en:
A very supportive and loving person, Aladin is a 34-year-old single man who supports the needs of his parents. Aladin has helped his father to manage their farm for ten years. 

Aladin is asking for a loan of PHP 21,000 to buy insecticide, fertilizer, and seeds for his farm so he can have additional income, save for his future, and also support the needs of his family. 

In the future, Aladin plans to purchase another plot of land for his future.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, fertilizer, and seeds for his farming business.

loans.name: Azipa

texts.ru:
Азипе 59 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Азипа на протяжении 25 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 1,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Азипы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 дойные коровы, 2 бычка, продажа молока и молочных продуктов составляет 17,000 сом в месяц.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Азипа обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 1 дойной коровы, что позволит ей увеличить надои.  Доходы от кредита Азипа планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Azipa is 59 years old, married, and has 2 children. For the past 25 years, Azipa has been raising livestock, having started her business with a sum of 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Azipa's herd currently has 2 dairy cows and 2 calves, with sales of milk and dairy products bringing 17,000 som per month.

In order to continue expanding her business, Azipa has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase another dairy cow, which will allow her to increase milk production. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further increasing the size of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Gerardo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Gerardo es un caballero perseverante con aspiraciones en la vida. Teniendo la profesion de contador ha venido desempeñandose y desarrollando sus conocimientos en empresas que necesitan de sus servicios. Teniendo a su cargo un hijo a quien apoya con sus estudios ya que se encuentra en periodo de la universidad y quien a su vez lo acompaña por ser el un hombre soltero sin una esposa que vele por el. Con creditos anteriores ha venido haciendole mejoras a su humilde casa misma que se encontraba bastante deteriorada, sin embargo su deseo es seguirle reinvirtiendo a la infraestructura de su vivienda, es por ello la razon de este nuevo credito ya que quiere levantar totalmente las paredes de su vivienda, para lograr dicho proyecto requerira comprar bloques, piedras canteras, cemento, perlines, hierro, laminas de zin. Agradece a la micro-financiera por siempre bindarle una mano amiga y contribuir al desarrollo de su hogar.
texts.en:
Gerardo is a persevering gentleman with life goals.  He works as an accountant and has been developing his skills and working for firms needing his services.  He has a son in his care whose schooling he supports; he’s at the university level.  His son, in his turn, keeps him company since Gerardo himself is a single man with no wife to care for him.

He’s used previous loans to make improvements to his humble house which was quite deteriorated. However his wish is to continue investing it his house’s infrastructure and this is the reason for this new loan because he wants to raise the walls completely and to do so needs to buy concrete blocks, paving stones, cement, purlines, rebar and metal sheeting. 

He thanks the micro-lender for always extending a friendly hand and contributing to the development of his home.

loans.use: to build walls.

loans.name: María Paula Otilia

texts.es:
EL Banco Divino Niño Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar vive la señora Paula, tiene 51 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo el  mismo que ya es mayor de edad y  aun vive en su casa. El marido trabaja en el Municipio de la localidad. 

Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, joyas de Romanel y productos de Oriflame (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas  diarias,  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Lleva 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los perfumes y ropa de damas.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, joyas y ropa. Lleva 8 años en  el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a uno de los créditos empezó su negocio que le permite ganar algo por su cuenta.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para realizar sus recorridos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Divino Niño Jesús" (Divine Christ Child) meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa, which is known by its nickname "The Sultana of Coffee" because of its extensive coffee crop that has an incomparable flavor. This area is also known for its food and the warmth of its people.

Sra. Paula lives in this place. She is 51 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has a grown son who still lives at home. Her husband works for the municipal government in their town.

Paula is a homemaker who generates her own income so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. She sells clothing through catalogs, as well as Romanel jewelry and Oriflame products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). Paula works three days a week for two to three hours each day. She has been in this business for seven years and has done very well. Paula says that perfumes and women's clothes are the products that she sells the most.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, jewelry, and clothing. Paula has been with her Communal Bank for eight years and enjoys being a member because one of the loans was used to start her business. This allowed her to earn an income of her own. Her dream is to have a car that she can use for running errands.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, jewelry, and clothing.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
After Dalia's last successful entrepreneurial venture of owning and managing a coffee shop with her husband, her entrepreneurial spirit sparked once again. Three years ago, Dalia went through some changes in her life and decided that she wanted to create a company that would provide a good service for the community around her. She decided to open an adult daycare facility for elderly individuals. She officially opened her business in April of 2011 and currently has five residents, with a capacity for six overall. 

The services that her company offers range from providing general care to more intense health care to general entertainment for the residents. Even though the company is still young, Dalia is very excited about its potential and loves what she is doing. She even mentions a resident who is 90 years old and originally from Cuba that she loves to listen to telling stories of Cuba and Miami from a long time ago. 

Dalia would like to use this loan to expand the services that she can offer her residents. She would like to buy a van to organize visits and trips. She would also like to purchase a new orthopedic chair for handicapped residents.

loans.use: to purchase a van to organize visits and trips for patients and to purchase a new orthopedic chair

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. Fely has a shop that sells barbeque. Aside from that, she also sells snacks like banana kebabs. She has had this business for 5 years. Fely requested a loan of 4,000 to buy fresh meat like beef, pork and dressed chicken for making barbeque. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Fely hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fresh beef, pork and dressed chicken to make barbeque.

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en:
Saleem, 59 years old and a married man, has five sons and one daughter. One of his sons got married recently.

Saleem owns a small shop selling fruits and vegetables, and he also distributes to the nearby grocery market when he brings large quantities from the farms. Now Saleem wants to open another store besides his store so as to expand and add more types of vegetables. For that reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to open another store besides his present store so as to expand

loans.name: Reem

texts.en:
Reem is a 34-year-old married lady. She has four children and her husband works in a public university.

Reem opened a small food store almost two years ago. During this period she was able to add more shelves and more food products, and recently she added selling nuts.

Now Reem wants to add selling some cleaning products, so she has applied for this loan to prepare a special section for them and buy those products.

loans.use: to prepare a special section for cleaning products and buy some to sell.

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Flor tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de Huachac.

Desde muy niña comenzó a adquirir los conocimientos del campo, de eso hace 35 años. La agricultura, hasta ese entonces, era su principal ingreso económico. Pero hace 10 años observó la necesidad de las personas de adquirir leña, entonces comenzó a vender leña al por mayor. Junto a su esposo adquieren los troncos y  seleccionan para venderlos en puntales y también en leña. Su trabajo requiere de mucha fortaleza física además de que siempre está pendiente de  comprar la madera, que en muchas oportunidades se presenta por medio de ocasiones de venta a módicos precios. Flor considera que su trabajo es rentable ya que siempre puede vender sus productos a un buen precio. Tiene planes de expandir sus zonas de venta en otras ciudades para lo cual se esforzará en aumentar su capital de trabajo.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Santo domingo” y éste es el noveno crédito con MFP. Considera que su grupo es un equipo solidario y muy unido, y se siente  muy contenta por ello. Esta la razón que la motiva a seguir esforzándose con la responsabilidad de mantener esa unidad, por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 

Flor invertirá el dinero de su préstamos en la compra de más leña, al por mayor, esto ayudará bastante al crecimiento de su capital.
texts.en:
Flor, age 43, lives with her husband and their two children in a rented house in Huachac.  Thirty-five years ago, when she was a little girl, she started learning about farming.  So far, farming has been her main income.  

Ten years ago she noticed the need that people have for wood.  Then she started to sell wood wholesale.  Together she and her husband get the trunks, and they choose to sell them as supports and as firewood.  Her work requires a lot of physical strength in addition to always being ready to buy the wood.  There are a lot of opportunities when there are sales at moderate prices.  

Flor considers her work to be profitable because she can always sell her products at a good price.  She has plans to expand her sales areas into other cities.  In order to do this, she will put forth great effort to increase her working capital.

She belongs to the Santo Domino communal bank, and this is her ninth loan with MFP.  She considers her group to be a supportive team that is very united.  She is very happy about that.  That is the reason that motivates her to continue working hard with the sense of responsibility to maintain this unity.  Therefore, she pledges to be punctual with her payments.  Flor will use the money from the loan to buy more firewood wholesale.  This will help her capital grow quite well.

loans.use: to buy more firewood.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
Tras 12 años de radicar en la zona donde actualmente vive, Janeth ha establecido su familia. Tiene 32 años, es madre de 2 pequeños y vive en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de Huachac.

Se dedica al comercio de verduras en el mercado de su localidad y de manera paralela arrendar terrenos de cultivo para sembrar ajos o cualquier producto que se oferte en el mercado a mayor precio. Vende todos los días en el mercado para que sus ganancias sean diarias. También, mientras espera el tiempo de la cosecha, contrata mano de obra para poder realizar su trabajo y paga por el transporte, por lo que ha visto por conveniente incrementar su capital para crecer en ambos negocios.

Este es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP y se siente muy contenta de pertenecer a su grupo, pues son personas solidarias, es por ello que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 

Este es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP y se siente muy contenta de pertenecer a su grupo, pues son personas solidarias, es por ello que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
After 12 years of living where she currently lives, Janeth has started her own family.  She’s 32 years old and is the mother of two little ones.  She lives in a rented house located in Huachac.

She sells vegetables in the local market and also leases land to grow garlic or whatever other product being sold at good market prices.  She sells in the market every day so that she can earn daily profits.  Also, while she’s waiting for harvest time, she hires laborer to do the work and she pays for transport which is why she feels she needs to increase her capital in order to grow in both businesses.

This is her 5th MFP loan and she feels very happy to belong to her group because they are very supportive people and this is why she promises to be punctual with her installment payments.

loans.use: to lease land.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
It gives Gerardo great pride to say that he is a self-sufficient entrepreneur and business owner who is able to provide for his family. Over ten years ago, Gerardo moved to the United States from Uruguay and was determined to use his skills to create a job for himself. Being a craftsman his whole life, he looked for a business that would incorporate the skills he had. Together with his wife, he created Florida Shutters and Blinds Inc. 

This business provides window installation and curating services, as well as consultation and installation of blinds, shades, and drapes. Gerardo and his wife hope to continue growing the business and one day hope that it will be able to incorporate other employees. This loan will be used to help further market the business within their community and further promote its growth.

loans.use: to improve marketing of the business within the community

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia, 33 years old and an illiterate woman. has five children. Her husband is a school bus driver.

Nadia has always wanted to help her husband and family get another source of income, but not knowing how to read or write has limited her options in getting a job. So she decided to start a small clothing sales business, buying from the wholesale market a specific quantity of clothes and selling them at a reasonable price. 

Now Nadia wants to start bringing the clothes from either a wholesale market or even the free zone area so that she can make more profit, and for that reason she has applied for this loan. 

In the future Nadia hopes that she can open a clothing store in the area rather than in her house.

loans.use: to bring in more clothes for sale

loans.name: Sorphoan's Group

texts.en: Sorphoan is 32 years old and a mother of three. All of her kids are still in school. She lives in a rural area of Kompong Cham province with a house with bamboo walls. To feed the family, she works as a construction worker and also cultivates a rice field. The main constraint for her family is having not enough money to send her children to school. She earns less than five US dollars per day to feed her family. Sorphoan has applied for a loan from VisionFund for the first time. She now leads a loan group of three female members. She requested the loan to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and gasoline for a water pump for her rice field. With this loan, she hopes to increase crop yield and generate more income to better feed her family and also to build on some savings to buy more rice fields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seeds, and gasoline for a water pump.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sally Nympha

texts.en: Sally Nympha is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Sally Nympha has a shop that provides manicures and pedicures in the community. She has had this business for 4 years. Sally Nympha requested a loan for 5,000 to cover the cost of electricity and to buy additional manicure materials such as nail polish, nail cutters, and acetone.

loans.use: to pay for electricity and buy manicure materials.

loans.name: Lina Moraima

texts.es:
LINA MORAYMA tiene 46 años de edad es divorciada tiene dos hijas, vive con las hijas de 26 y 6 años de edad en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

LINA MORAYMA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, yuca, plátano verde, ademñas trabaja en un restaurante de comida. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, fertilizantes, urea, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes. Las compras lo hará en Chillanes. El sueño es poder tener casa propia, tener un negocio estable.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta leer la biblia, cantar, ver televisión.
texts.en:
Lina Morayma is 46 years old, divorced, and has two daughters (ages 26 and 6). She lives with her daughters in Chillanes, which is in Bolívar Province.

Lina Morayma is a farmer who grows cacao, cassava, and green plantains. She also works at a restaurant. Lina is requesting a loan to buy insecticides, fertilizers, urea, and compost. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy fertilizers. Her purchases are conducted in Chillanes. Her dream is to have a house of her own and a stable business. The challenges she faces include dealing with the competition.

In her free time, Lina Morayma enjoys reading the Bible, singing, and watching television.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizers, urea, and compost.

loans.name: Olimpio

texts.es:
Olimpio tiene 68 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, a los que quiere mucho. En armonía familiar viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de El Tambo.

Siempre responsable, todas las mañanas se levanta con la convicción de encontrarse con sus clientes, los que le compran productos de primera necesidad por más de 31 años. Decidió tener una tienda de abarrotes en su misma casa  aprovechando que se ubica en una avenida grande de su barrio. Atiende todos los días, junto a su esposa, y siempre abastece a su clientela con lo que necesitan y les da una atención cálida y amable, por lo que sus clientes son fieles a su tienda. Su negocio es el más concurrido de la zona y las mejores épocas de año donde tiene más venta es en fiestas patrias y navidad, por lo que su deseo es continuar con este negocio. 

Olimpio pertenece a un grupo solidario y éste es su crédito número diecinueve con MFP. Él es uno de los socios más antiguos y siempre motiva a los demás integrantes a ser unidos, responsables y colaboradores con las diversas actividades, además disfruta de realizar este trabajo porque dice que lo llena de gran satisfacción y vitalidad para salir adelante.

El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Olimpio, 68, lives with his wife and two children who he loves very much.  He lives in family harmony in his own house located in El Tambo.

Always responsible, he rises every morning convinced that he’ll run into his customers who have bought basic staples from him for more than 31 years.  He decided to open a grocery store at home taking advantage of it being located on one of his neighborhood’s main avenues.  He’s open every day alongside his wife and always supplies his clientele with what they need providing kind, warm service which is why his customers are loyal to his store.  His store is the busiest in the zone and the seasons when sales are best are during feast days and Christmas; his wish is to stay in business.

Olimpio belongs to a solidarity group and this is MFP loan #19.  He’s one of the longest-standing members of the group and always motivates the other members to be united, responsible and very cooperative with the various activities.  He also enjoys this work because he says that it fills him with satisfaction and vitality to get ahead.

He will use the requested money to buy basic staple items to stock his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de El Tambo.

Desde hace 14 años se dedica a la venta de verduras en un mercadillo de su localidad que está muy cerca de su casa. Todas la mañanas, hasta medio día realiza sus ventas, pero su jornada de trajo siempre comienza en la madrugadas porque se abastece diariamente de las verduras para que estén frescas, al gusto de su clientela, y porque las verduras son productos fácilmente perecibles. Sin embargo, considera rentable su negocio porque es muy demandado, especialmente por las amas de casa quienes diariamente le compran. Y eso es muy favorable en su negocio porque recibe ingresos diarios que administra adecuadamente para afrontar con éxito los gastos de su hogar y para reinvertir nuevamente. Por esta razón continuará trabajando en su puesto de mercado con la mentalidad de crecer más. 

Ella pertenece al grupo “Mujeres del nuevo milenio” y éste es el crédito número 20 con MFP, por lo que se siente agradecida, pues sin su apoyo no progresaría. Por esa razón promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.

Clara invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de temporada como; verduras, frutas y tubérculos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Clara is 45 and lives with her husband and 4 children in their own home in El Tambo. For 14 years, she has sold vegetables from a small stand located near her home. Every morning until noon she sells her products, but her workday begins at dawn because she stocks her vegetables daily so that they are fresh, as her customers like them, and because vegetables spoil easily. However, her business is profitable due to the great demand, particularly from the homemakers who shop daily. This is great for her business because Clara has daily income that more than covers her household expenses and can be reinvested. Therefore, she will continue working at her stand and focus on growing the business.

She belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres del nuevo milenio” [Women of the New Millennium], and this is her 20th loan cycle with MFP. She is grateful because without this support, she would not get ahead. Clara will use this loan to buy seasonal products like vegetables, fruits, and potatoes for her business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Alma has a shop that sells "longganisa" and hotdogs. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients  used in making hotdogs and longganisa like fresh beef, onion, salt, seasoning, pepper and also plastic cellophane.

Alma has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Alma hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients used in making "longganisa" (sausage) and hotdogs

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante has been involved in vending activities, particularly selling vegetables and fruit. It's been ten years of patient and hard work he had devote in his backyard vegetable garden. He always ensures that his vegetable crop is not affected by any pests in order for him to have a plentiful harvest.

Dante paid back his previous loan and this time he is asking for bigger loan amounting to P12,000 which will be used to buy pesticides and vegetable seeds to improve his backyard garden. He hopes that his business will grow further so that he can uplift his living conditions out from poverty. He knows that he can make his backyard garden more productive.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and vegetable seeds to improve his  backyard  vegetable garden

loans.name: Dominica

texts.en: Dominica raises hogs within her local community. She has been operating this kind business for more than three years. Dominica is 53 years of age, is married, and has three grown up children. She aims to cover all their basic needs and improve their living condition - that's why she is doing her best in order to obtain her goals in life. Dominica is glad because her previous loan had a really great impact on her business. Dominica would like to take out a loan in the amount of P25,000 allowing her to buy livestock feed and vaccine, to ensure the good growth of the hogs she raises. According to Dominica, meeting the hogs' needs will make them healthy, which will give her better price when they reach their optimum growth. She hopes that her business will grow further so that she can put some money in emergency savings for her family.

loans.use: to buy livestock feeds and vaccine to ensure the good growth of her raised hogs

loans.name: Horn

texts.en: Horn, 56, is married and lives in a rural area of Kompong Cham province. She has seven children and two of them are still dependent on the family: one works at the field and the youngest one is still in school. Horn has grown rice, plants, and vegetables to feed the family for more than ten years. Her primary obstacle is when there is a disaster and she does not have enough investment in her business. Horn has been with VisionFund since 2011. Her income is used to buy necessary household equipment and food for the family. Now she is requesting for a second loan from VisionFund. She wishes to get money to buy fertilizers and rice seeds and cultivate a rice field. With this loan, she hopes to make more income to better feed her family and expand her business.

loans.use: to cultivate a rice field and buy fertilizers and rice seeds.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Melchor

texts.es:
Melchor es un joven de 23 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposa y su pequeño de tres años el cual es su adoración y el nos comenta que es el regalo mas grande que Dios le ha dado, ya que desde que nació solo ha traído bendiciones a su hogar, el nos dice que es muy duro el trabajo de manera diaria pero su hijo y su esposa ameritan ese esfuerzo ya que viéndolos bien el está feliz; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el algodón, el plátano, entre otros; con mucho esfuerzo Con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro Melchor se compro una mototaxi en la cual iba trabajando diariamente y su esposa lo apoyaba en su negocio de venta de pre cocidos ( frejol, pallar, lenteja, entre otros, estos insumos sancochados);  lamentablemente el motor de su vehículo se malogro y tuvo que venderla, actualmente trabaja en una mototaxi alquilada, trabaja alrededor de 10 horas y el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy dedicado y amble con los clientes.

Melchor está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una moto de segunda mano para poder tener un vehículo propio para seguir trabajando, esta mejora le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y ya no tener que seguir alquilando la movilidad, así el podrá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y ser un gran empresario”.
texts.en:
Melchor is 23 years old and lives with his wife and their three-year-old little boy, who is his pride and joy. Melchor says that he is the greates gift that God has given him, because ever since he was born, he has brought nothing but blessings to their home. He says its very hard to work every day, but that his son and wife deserve the effort, because seeing they are well makes him happy.

Their home is located in the city of Imperial, which is known for its warm weather as well as its agriculture, particularly cotton and plantains, among other crops. Through much effort and saving, Melchor purchased a mototaxi which he used for work daily. His wife supported him in the business selling preecooked products (beans, lima beans, lentils, and other parboiled ingredients). Unfortunately his vehicle's engine broke down and he had to sell it. Currently he works with a rental mototaxi. He works around 10 hours and he believes business is going well for him because he is very dedicated and kind to his customers. 

Melchor is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they have offered he will be able to purchase a used mototaxi so that he has a vehicle to keep working. This improvement will allow him to improve his income and relieve him of having to pay rent for his mobility. This way he will be able to keep fighting every day towards making his greatest dream come true: to give his son a good education and to become a great businessman.

loans.use: to purchase a mototaxi.

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en: Yen is a 62-year-old mother of five. Three of her children reside with the family. To make a living, she has been cultivating rice and growing plants for over forty years. Yen and the other two members of her group have been with VisionFund since 2009. They are now applying for their fourth loan. Yen will use her portion of the loan to buy cassava plants and grow them. She hopes to grow more cassava with a good yield and earn more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy cassava plants and grow them

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
Federico, 54 years old, is married with two adult children. His wife Regina helps him to manage their one-hectare field. Fredico is very hardworking person. He wakes up early to visit his rice field and he makes sure that his crops are good. 

Federico is asking for a loan of PHP 24,000 to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for his farming business so that he will have good quality rice which is easy to sell in the future. Frederico hopes that his farm business will expand so that he can supply the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for his farming business

loans.name: Ana Portia

texts.en:
Ana Portia is 43 years old and married with 6 children. With 4 children in school, Ana Portia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Ana Portia sells a variety of items such as coffee, cream,  sugar, canned goods, eggs, etc.

In the future Ana Portia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Jenet

texts.en:
Jenet is 25 years old and married with 2 children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Jenet is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jenet has been farming sugarcane for 5 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Aillen

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Aillen works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  Aillen is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Aillen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es: Rosibel de 48 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está integrado por su compañero de vida y sus 5 hijos,  dos de los cuales se encuentran estudiando.  Para Rosibel  lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que trabaja duramente para poder dar el pan de cada día y cubrir las principales necesidades. Ella  se dedica a la venta de deliciosas tortillas. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya ha adquirido mucha experiencia, además ha logrado establecer algunos clientes que son muy fieles al servicio que ella ofrece. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales, en mejores condiciones que las que ella  ha tenido. Esta es la razón por la que lucha con todas sus fuerzas para mantener vivo el negocio que por muchos años le ha proporcionado lo necesario para sobrevivir.  Vale la pena mencionar que en cuanto a competencia, Rosibel no tiene problemas ya que no hay muchos negocios parecidos en la zona. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, es decir,  poder tener la capacidad de cubrir una mayor demanda que le genere mayores ingresos. Esto la ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la materia prima necesaria (maíz y harinas) al por mayor para seguir produciendo las deliciosas tortillas.  Espera lograr su objetivo de cubrir una mayor demanda que le genere una mejora en los ingresos percibidos de tal forma que su calidad de vida y la de su familia puedan mejorar.
texts.en:
Rosibel is 48 years old and lives in her own home with her family, which consists of her life companion and their five children. Two of her children are studying. Family is the most important thing to Rosibel, so she works hard to feed her family each day and provide for their essential needs. Rosibel sells delicious tortillas. She has been in this business for many years and has gained plenty of experience. She has a few customers who are very loyal to the products that she offers. Her dream is to see her children become professionals so that they will have better conditions than she had. This is why she invests all of her effort into maintaining the life of her business, which has provided her the means to survive for many years.

It is worth mentioning that in terms of the competition, Rosibel does not face this problem because there are not many businesses like hers that are in the area. Her dream is to expand her business. In other words, she wants to have the capacity to keep up with the growing demand and be able to generate more income. Therefore, Rosibel decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can invest in supplies (corn and flour) in bulk and continue to produce her delicious tortillas.

Rosibel hopes to achieve her goal of meeting the growing demand so that she can have more revenue and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and flour.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 51 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, y vive en compañía de Ricardo, su esposo, desde hace 17 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos: Cristian, Alison y Jessica. Su casa es propia y está ubicada en la localidad de El Tambo.   

En este momento ella se siente feliz porque su esposo consiguió trabajar como alfabetizador en un programa del gobierno local, “su sueño”, comenta. Su familia conformó una empresa de pintado de locales, gracias a su constancia logró adquirir varios contratos para pintar colegios y casas; el servicio adicional que ella da es el pintado con diseños. Sus buenas ganancias le permitirán adquirir más máquinas para pintar, así como hace poco compró una comprensora. Pero como es una mujer trabajadora, también se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas y CDs en un local que adquirió por su casa, para el futuro quiere convertirlo en una fuente de soda para poder trabajar con toda la familia, “mi hija y mi yerno ayudan en mi negocio, juntos trabajamos y terminamos muy rápido nuestro trabajo, somos un buen equipo”, comenta.

Ella pertenece al grupo “Mujeres del nuevo milenio” y éste es el crédito número 24 que tiene con MFP, por lo que se siente agradecida, pues sin su apoyo no progresaría. Por esa razón promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.

Antes, Julia poseía una granja de cuyes, ahora desea retomar la crianza de estos animalitos, por lo que invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de nuevos ejemplares para aumentar su granja.
texts.en:
Julia, 51, is a very hardworking woman living with Ricardo, her husband, for 17 years; they have four children but only three of them live with them: Cristian, Alison and Jessica.  Her house is hers and it’s located in El Tambo.

At present she feels happy because her husband succeeded in getting a job working as a literacy tutor in a program of the local government, his dream, she comments.  

Her family started a building painting firm.  Thanks to her dedication she managed to get several contracts to paint schools and houses.  The added service she provides is painting designs.  Her good profits made it possible for her to buy more painting machines and a short while ago bought an air compressor.

But being a hardworking woman, she also sells hamburgers and CDs in a locale she got near her house which she wants to turn into a soda fountain in the future to work there with her entire family.  “My daughter and son-in-law help me in my business.  We work together and finish our work very quickly; we are a good work team,” she comments.

She belongs to the “Mujeres del Nuevo Milenio” (Women of the New Millennium) group and this is MFP loan #24 she’s had for which she feels very grateful because without the support she would not progress and this is why she promises to be punctual with her installment payments.

Julia used to have a guinea pig farm and wants to start raising these little animals again which is how she’ll invest the requested money: to buy new guinea pigs to add to her farm.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a hardworking woman with three children who are all of school-going age. She owns an electronics shop, which she has been operating for some time. She got her initial capital from poultry farming, which is a business she still runs. She faces challenges of price fluctuations. Her goal for her family is to work hard and educate her children. She dreams of expanding her business to new markets and also boosting her poultry projects. Sarah needs the loan to buy electronics for resale.

loans.use: to buy electronics for resale

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma is a 34-year-old married man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the coffee business for seven years. The business is very profitable. His hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, and inadequate capital to purchase inventory, as the demand for export is very high. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent house. His business goal is to expand the business into new markets. Juma wants money to buy coffee for resale.

loans.use: to buy coffee for resale

loans.name: Katia

texts.es:
Katia tiene 45 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora. Durante toda su vida cuidó de su hija Berenice, pues se separó de su esposo hace mucho tiempo. Ahora, con optimismo, sale adelante en la localidad de El Tambo.  

Sus días se centran en su trabajo, se dedica a varias labores durante el día. Desde muy temprano cuida a niñas menores en una casa, de donde recibe un sueldo mensual, fijo. Con este sueldo cubre las necesidades del hogar. Ya en la noches, se coloca un mandil, y con sus prodigiosas manos y las ganas de salir adelante, comienza a preparar los ricos bocaditos y tortas que sus clientes le piden diariamente. Ella no se desanima, le gusta trabajar en la noche y a pesar de estar un poco cansada, se esfuerza para brindarle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida, eso la motiva. Por ello no pierde el tiempo en ningún instante, por el contrario, los fines de semana también vende productos de belleza, con lo que obtiene otras ganancias, ya que lleva años ofreciendo este servicio. Así es como Katia se gana la vida, su sueño es tener una pastelería, grande surtida y sobre todo reconocida por el rico sabor de los dulces. 

Este es el noveno crédito que tiene con MFP, le agrada salir adelante en compañía de su grupo, pues en todo este tiempo la ayudó a salir adelante en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 	

Katia invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una batidora grande, eléctrica para la elaboración de sus exquisitos pasteles y bocaditos.
texts.en:
Katia is 45 years old and is a very hardworking woman. She has taken care of her daughter Berenice all her life, since she and her husband separated a long time ago. Now, with optimism, she makes a living in the town of El Tambo.  

Her days revolve around work, and she has several jobs during the day. Starting early in the morning, she takes care of some little girls in a house. There she gets paid a fixed monthly salary, which she uses to cover her needs in the home. In the evenings, she puts on an apron and, with her exceptional hands and her eagerness to get ahead, she starts preparing the delicious pastries and cakes that her customers come for every day. She doesn't get discouraged, she enjoyes working at night, and even though she gets a little tired, she struggles to give her daughter a better quality of life, and that motivates her. That is why she never wastes time. On the contrary, on weekends she also sells beauty products, which provides some more income, since she has been offering this service for years. This is how Katia earns a living. Her dream is to have a large, well-stocked bakery that may be well renouned for the delicious flavor of her sweets. 

This is her ninth loan with MFP. She enjoys moving forward with her group, because it has helped her all along to get ahead with her business. That is why she promises to pay her installments timely.	

Katia will invest the requested money in purchasing a large electric mixer to make her delicious cakes and pastries.

loans.use: to purchase an electric mixer.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi used her previous loan to purchase additional stock which greatly improved her retail shop. Her profits increased by 50% from the additional stock she bought. Consequently, her living standard and that of the family has greatly improved.

With the loan amount she wants to cultivate her farm where she grows maize both for food and for sale. She will use the money to pay for labor and purchase maize seeds.

She hopes someday to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase maize seeds and pay labor for farm cultivation

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en: Lucena, a 56-year-old married mother of two children, sells fish to support the daily needs of her family. For 15 years she has run this business in Maquilao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She earns 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lucena joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 9,700 PHP to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Lucena plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets

loans.name: Melizza Mariott

texts.en:
Melizza Mariott is 23 years old and works as a kindergarten teacher. She said that she chose this career because she loves children. She has completed her B.A. in educational studies and recently began a master's degree program. A loan will help Melizza Mariott pay for her tuition. Her aspiration is to open her own kindergarten.

Melizza Mariott is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank Comuzone I in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to pay her master's degree tuition

loans.name: Gillena

texts.en:
Gillena is 28 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in Kasese, Uganda.  She has been in the tailoring business for five years. 

Gillena is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a designer tailoring machine.  Her challenges are price fluctuation, inflation, and inadequate capital to purchase stock.  Gillena's business goals are buying modern tailoring equipment and expanding her business into new markets.  Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring designer machine

loans.name: Nehemiya

texts.en: Nehemiya is a 42-year-old business man who sells new clothes in Bundibugyo,Uganda.  He is married adn has four children, three of them are still in school.  He has been in the business for 15 years and it has been very lucrative since he was able to build a house and pay school fees for his children.  He has challenges in customers not paying on time and high taxes that minimize his profits.  He has dreams of educating his children to attain high qualifications and setting up a boutique.  Nehemiya needs the loan to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell
